loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has since restarted her food vending business. 

Lorena has been with the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation since 2013. She is now requesting a housing loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour to build a house for her family.

With your help, Lorena will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 38 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. Marcelina and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Marcelina is taking out a housing loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Marcelina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her fishing business. With your help, Marcelina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dewanie

texts.en:
Dewanie is 33-years-old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dewanie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dewanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Dewanie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Dewanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 33-years-old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Margie has restarted her  business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Margie has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Margie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: J-Rose

texts.en:
J-Rose is 24-years-old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

J-Rose has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. J-Rose requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

J-Rose has been in this business for four years. In the future, J-Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is married and she works hard to support her family. She has general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothes. Emma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell in her store. Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en: Geneveve is 44 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geneveve has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Geneveve has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 46-year-old married mother of seven children. Four of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Janet has a food vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Janet has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, Super Typhoon Haiyan wiped out her business and home. She has restarted her general store business and been in NWTF since 2013. She is now requesting a PHP 4,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Milagros will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 60-years-old, married and has nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosemarie has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jesus De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El estar rodeado de  sembrados  de café y frijoles en su juventud  fue de mucha influencia para  Jesús. Sin embargo, el destino lo llevó a emigrar otro país en búsqueda de mejores condiciones de vida.  Trabajó duro, consiguió ahorrar y logró regresar a su patria. El capital lo utilizó  para invertir en la compra de tierras.  Hizo realidad su sueño  de sembrar café, frijoles y maíz. Esa idea la tuvo en  mente desde el momento que en partió.
Sus cultivos  han tenido una buena aceptación en toda la región.  Las ganancias las utilizó para invertir en ganado. Por el momento los dos negocios marchan de maravilla. Jesús desea que sus cultivos sigan sanos y libre de plagas. Por eso recurrió a KIVA y  MiCrédito, porque  esta institución siempre apoya a pequeños agricultores como él.  El dinero será  destinado  para la compra de abono, boro sulfato de cobre y otros refrescantes.
texts.en:
Being surrounded by coffee and bean plantations in his youth had a large influence on Jesús. However, fate led him to emigrate to another country in search of better living conditions. He worked hard, managed to save, and succeeded in returning to his home country.

He used his savings to invest in purchasing land. His dream of planting coffee, beans and maize came true. He had had this idea since the moment he left. 

His crops have been well accepted throughout the region. His earnings were used to invest in livestock. For the moment, these two businesses are going wonderfully. 

Jesús wants his crops to continue being healthy and free of pests. For this reason, he appealed to KIVA and MiCredito, because this institution always supports small farmers like him. The money will be used to buy fertilizer, boron copper sulfate and other refreshers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, boron copper sulfate, and other refreshers.

loans.name: Alda

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, casada, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y dos menores de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de 14 años de ser docente. Su esposo es comerciante. Con el objetivo de ampliar su vivienda solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, zinc, madera, clavo y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es hacer su casa de concreto de dos pisos.
texts.en:
She is a native of Waspam, married and 36 years old. She has 5 children, of whom 3 are adolescents, who are attending  secondary school, while two are younger.  She has had experience as a teacher for 14 years.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is requesting funding with the goal of expanding her home. She will purchase construction materials: cement, zinc, wood, nails and cover the costs of labor. Her dream is to have a two story, concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: cement, zinc, wood, nails and cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Juana Deysi

texts.es: Juana tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a  sus tres hijos de 16 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. Juana se dedica a la venta de medicina natural de forma ambulante. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con este negocio y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y logra mantener a su familia. Juana desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como arena, cemento y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old and lives in a house she owns with her three children, who are 16, 14 and 12 years old.  Juana sells natural medicine as a street vendor.  She has had this business for a long time. That is how she brings sustenance to her home and supports her family.

Juana wants to improve her living conditions. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase the necessary materials, such as sand, cement and gravel in order to set a concrete floor in her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel in order to set a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Martína

texts.es: Martina tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, dos hijas de 19 años y 15 años y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Martina es una mujer trabajadora y comprometida con su familia. Ella se gana la vida trabajando como operaria en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Martina solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda y así dar a su familia mejores condicione de desarrollo.
texts.en: Martina is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her mother, two daughters - aged 19 and 15 years old respectively - and her 17-year-old son. Martina is a hard-working woman, and dedicated to her family. She earns a living working at a local business. Martina is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to install electricity in her home and offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in installing electricity in her home.

loans.name: Meludina

texts.en:
This is Meludina a 32-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, Jonathan, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Meludina operates a buy and sell business of different products. What she basically does, is buy items from a wholesaler and sell them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from bags such as school bags, and accessories like silver and other products of the same kind. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of bags and silver accessories to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Meludina hopes to have her own stall and dreams to expand her business so that she can provide her children's needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. In the picture, Luz is carrying one of her children who serves her as her inspiration to move on after the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. Luz's house was destroyed when Haiyan swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Luz is taking out a 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to build a new house for her family.

Luz has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start again in a new home. In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en: Nilfa is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Nilfa and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Nilfa is taking out a housing loan amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been a NWTF borrower since 2013. With your help, Nilfa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and been in NWTF since 2008 and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 55-years-old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lida has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lida requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lida has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 35-years-old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosalie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rosalie is taking out a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Rosalie has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 36 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Rosalie's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She restarted her fish-vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rosalie is taking out a 5,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Rosalie has been with NWTF since 2008 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosario restarted her fish-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a 7,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor.

Rosario is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y  está acompañado, es padre de 3 hijos el primero de 12 años, el segundo de 11 y el más pequeño que tiene 9 años de edad y solo ellos con sus hijos viven. José pero presta sus servicio como motorista desde hace 20 años.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para consolidar una deuda con otra institución crediticia.  

El sueño de José es poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia  y esto lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y con los créditos de credicampo.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old, and left school after the 6th grade. He has a partner and three children aged 12, 11 and 9, with whom he lives. For 20 years, José has worked providing services as a motorcycle driver.
 
He is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO, to consolidate a loan with another loan company.

José's dream is to offer his family a better quality of life, which he will achieve with the help of God and Credicampo loans.

loans.use: to consolidate a loan with another loan company.

loans.name: Gervacio Faustino

texts.es:
Gervacio de 82 años de edad, es padre de 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, 6 de ellos se encuentran residiendo en estados unidos  y una de sus hijas reside en la ciudad. Él estudio hasta 4 grado en ese tiempo era complicado asistir a la escuela  porque sus padres lo ponían a trabajar.

Él comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeño, cuando obtuvo su primer financiamiento fue con el BFA, actualmente sus ingresos los obtiene de un ganado y de las remesas que mensualmente recibe de sus hijos.

El financiamiento será invertido en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, otra parte será para colocar un alambre perimetral alrededor de un terreno, pretende hacer la compra de un cerdo para cuando se llegue la fecha de realzar la cancelación del  crédito poder venderlo y hacer la cancelación de este.


Su sueño es seguir trabajando,  y salir bien con el compromiso que tiene, él se encuentra muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza que se le a dado a través de la aprobación de los créditos.
texts.en:
Gervacio is 82 years old, and is the father of seven children, who are all grown ups. Six of them live in the United States, and one of his daughters lives in the city. He left school after the 4th grade, as at that time, it was complicated for him to go to school because his parents made him work.

He started working from a very young age. He received his first loan from the BFA. He currently makes a living from his livestock and the money that his children send him each month.

He will invest the loan in growing corn and beans, building a wire fence around his plot of land, and trying to buy a pig, so that when the time comes to pay back the loan, he will be able to sell the pig to achieve this.

His dream is to continue working, and make a success of the commitment he is making. He feels very grateful to the organisation for the trust it has placed in him through approving his loans.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans, build a wire fence around his plot of land, and try to buy a pig.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.en:
Maria Norma is a 64-year-old widow with seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Maria Norma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Norma has been farming sugarcane for 18 years and she also earns additional income from fishing. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

Santas restarted her food-vending business. She has been with NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a 4,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Santas will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 28 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like soap, sugar, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

Marivic has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, curls and soaps. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, sugar, noodles, sardines and other groceriees.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 46 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Rosemarie's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rosemarie is taking out a 8,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rosemarie has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 71 years old and single. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fely has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from tailoring. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Teresita has restarted her pig-fattening business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Teresita has taken a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Teresita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Miurel Francisca

texts.es:
Miurel tiene una gran variedad de calzado para todos los gustos  y  tallas. Dio sus primeros pasos al comercio vendiendo bisutería fina. Las ganancias fueron utilizadas para rentar un local en el mercado de la ciudad y gracias a su determinación, entusiasmo y  empeño logró abrir su tienda de zapatos. Cada día  la suma de visitantes aumenta,  por los estilos modernos que ofrece y por la excelente atención. 
Anhela  ofertar  su  calzado  en  ferias nacionales e internacionales, ya que así sus productos  se darían a conocer  en otros departamentos y más allá del territorio nacional. Sus ventas continúan en auge y Miurel por supuesto, desea seguir esa línea de ventas. Por lo tanto  optó por un financiamiento en KIVA y  MiCrédito, para la compra de nuevos estilos de  zapatos.  En un futuro planea  adquirir su propio local en vez de rentarlo.
texts.en:
Miurel has a great variety of shoes for all tastes and sizes. She took her first steps as a merchant by selling fine costume jewelry. Her profits were used to rent a space in the city market and, thanks to her determination, enthusiasm and effort, she succeeded in opening a shoe store. Each day her customers increase due to the modern styles she offers and her excellent service.

She longs to sell her footwear at national and international festivals since in that way her products would become known in other regions and even beyond her own country. Her sales continue booming and Miurel, of course, wants to continue with this line of sales. Consequently she chose a loan from KIVA and MiCrédito in order to purchase new shoe styles. In the future she plans to own her store rather than renting it.

loans.use: to purchase new shoe styles.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school.  Arlene works very hard to provide for her family.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is still in school.

Violeta and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Violeta is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Violeta has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Violeta can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super Typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Etchel

texts.en:
Etchel is 54 years old and a widowed mother of six children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Etchel has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Etchel requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Etchel has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Etchel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a hardworking woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan.

Besides the clothes-selling business, Kanini operates a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase maize and beans for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman, and she has five children all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expense is food.

Umazi operates a cereal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
This is Jeralyn, 30, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines.  She is married to Robinson and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jeralyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jeralyn dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru:
Хамида 44-летняя жительница района Шахритус. У нее среднее специальное образование. Однако последние 10 лет она занимается растениеводством. Хамида выращивает огородные культуры. Ей помогают дети. У нее четверо детей. Муж работает вдали от семьи, в Российской Федерации.
Хамида обратилась за кредитом для приобретения минеральных удобрений, чтобы обработать посевы. Она хочет летом собрать богатый урожай и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Hamida is a 44-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She has a specialist high school education, and has been working in agriculture for the past 10 years. She grows market crops with the help of her four children. Her husband works away from the family, in Russia.

Hamida is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers to improve the soil. She wants to bring in a large harvest this summer and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to improve her harvest

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business. She has been in NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Virgie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Virgie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn is 38 years old and married with six children. With five of her children currently in school, Merelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merelyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Merelyn has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Merelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Cielo

texts.en:
Ma. Cielo is 59 years old and widowed with one child. Ma. Cielo works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Cielo's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ma. Cielo has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Cielo has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Cielo is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 59 years old and a widowed mother of seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Marianita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marianita has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2011, and she is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Carmen will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old and married with two children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other groceries.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Elsie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and married with five children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as sardines, sugar, beverages and other groceries.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sardines, sugar, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with eleven children. With three children currently in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Alicia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Alicia has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Alicia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman with seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, cooking oil, and paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, and paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with five children, none of whom goes to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated this fruits and vegetables stall business for the past eight years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Fazilamo

texts.ru: Фазиламо 42 года. Она женщина скотовод из городка Дангара. Фазиламо живет там вместе с мужем и тремя детьми. Ее старшей  дочери 12 лет, младшей дочери 7 лет, а сыну 9 лет. Все они посещают местную школу. Муж Фазиламо работает в ГЭСе. Сама Фазиламо занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. В течение 6 лет она разводит коров и быков. Целью ее запрашиваемого кредита является увеличение поголовья скота. Фазиламо надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Fazilamo is a 42-year-old woman from the city of Dangara. She lives there with her husband and three children and works as a cattle herder. Her oldest daughter is 12, her youngest daughter seven and her son nine. They all attend the local school, and Fazilamo's husband works at the electrical station. 

Fazilamo has been raising cows and steers for six years. Her goal with this loan is to increase her head count of livestock. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her livestock head count

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 36 years old and married with two children. Jimmy is a very hardworking person. He has been engaged in the farming business for eight years. 

When he got married to Sotrania, he borrowed money to buy one hectare of agricultural land and now he still manages the land. To have additional income, he is asking a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business.

In the future, Jimmy hopes that he can fulfill all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru: Гульхумор работает швеей в своем районе Дангара. Она 43-летняя замужняя женщина, имеющая троих сыновей в возрасте 7, 18 и 20 лет. Ее муж мастер строитель. Сама Гульхумор сидит дома и занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она шьет только платья национального стиля. Гульхумор занимается данной деятельностью уже 5 лет. Она просит кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки с целью развития своего дела и надеется, что ей окажут поддержку.
texts.en: Gulkhumor works as a tailor in her region of Dangara. She is 43 and married with three sons aged seven, 18 and 20. Her husband is a master builder, and she works from home sewing women's clothing to order, a business she has been working in for five years. She only sews dresses in the national style. Gulkhumor is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine with the goal of developing her business and hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business

loans.name: Albena

texts.en:
Albena is a thirty years old lady. She is a widow and has three children. She runs a retail cereals store and she has been in this business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings, which she uses to support her family. 


This is her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy additional stocks of maize and beans for the cereal store. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her ready-to-wear business. She was also able to help her family in their everyday expenses at home. She continues to work hard to provide for her everyday needs and to be able to help her family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to buy additional stock of merchandise, such as pants and children's, men's and women's clothing, needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to help her family to improve their quality of living. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise, such as pants and children's, men's and women's clothing, needed in her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is Florence. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florence dreams of a stable and simple yet adequate kind of living and hopes to operate her very own restaurant someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organised into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Imelda has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Imelda has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Imelda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old and widowed with two children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Edna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Edna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilyma

texts.en:
Lilyma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business. She has been in NWTF since 2007 and is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Lilyma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Lilyma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 54 years old and married with three children.

Nelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Nelfa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Nelfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 39 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Josefina has a food market business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business. She has been in NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Lotis will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old, married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 140,00 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Victoria has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, and paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, and paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin is 20 years old. He is a student who lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He has moved to Phnom Penh to study at university. He also works as a staff of a petroleum station and earns approximately $3 per day. Due to the lack of money he would like to apply for loan of $500 to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him get a higher education. In the future Rin hopes that he can get a good job with good salary and build a new house.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married with 1 child. Natividad is 56 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.
Natividad is a farmer and raises poultry to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to provide additional capital for her poultry business to purchase trays of eggs for retail.
Natividad has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future Natividad hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs for retail

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy clothing for adults and children needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional clothing items like pants, polo shirts, shorts fro kids, different dresses, shirts and other products for resale in her business. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Imelda hopes to be more successful in business and have more stalls. She dreams of helping her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products like pants, polo shirts, shorts for kids, different dresses, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old, married and has four children. She has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income is KES.10,000.

She has borrowed money to buy more maize for resale. The anticipated profit she makes will be used to expand her business. This is her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya. 


Jane serviced her previous loan successfully. Her hopes and dreams are to prosper both in her family and her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for her business

loans.name: Mary Jen

texts.en:
Mary Jen is 27 years old, married, and has two children. One child is currently in school.

Mary Jen and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Mary Jen is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mary Jen has been an NWTF borrower since 2014.

With your help, Mary Jen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Erliza

texts.en:
Erliza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erliza is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Erliza's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Erliza is taking out a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Erliza has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Erliza would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta de 56 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de profesora, ya está divorciada y también ya se jubilo tiene dos hijos que viven con ella los cuales están estudiando y solo la hija depende de ella.


Elle no tiene ningún negocio, pero de la pensión que le dan mensualmente le ayuda a su hija para los estudios universitarios.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar medicamentos para ella y para cubrir unos gastos de la universidad de su hija. 

El sueño de Marta es que su hija sea una persona muy preparada académicamente en el futuro y el crédito le ayuda mucho para los gastos que ella tiene en la universidad.
texts.en:
Marta, 56 years old, has a teaching degree. She is now divorced and has retired.  Marta has two children living with her who are in school, and only her daughter depends on her.

She does not have a business, but the monthly pension she receives helps her daughter pursue a college education.   

The loan she is seeking is to buy medications for herself and to cover some college costs for her daughter.

Marta's dream is that her daughter will be well prepared academically in the future, and the loan will help her a lot with her daughter's college costs.

loans.use: to buy medications for herself and to cover some college costs for her daughter

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 28 years old and married with four children. Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mercy has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mercy has taken out a 9,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mercy is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 45 years old, is married with 3 children. She manages a farm with the help of her husband Jose; her husband is the one who checks their crops every morning.

Gladys is very patient person. She loves to devote her time to serving her family. But today she admits that she doesn't have enough money to sustain the needs of the farm. That's why she is asking for a loan amounting 35,000 PHP to buy seeds and farm supplies for her farming business.

She only dreams that she can meet all of her family's needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies for her farming business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 55 years old and lives in Mialen Clarin, Philippines. He is married with 3 children.

Antonio is a tricycle driver. He earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Antonio has requested a loan to provide capital for his banana cue business to purchase bundles of bananas for his snack vending business. This is Antonio's new business venture for added income.

Antonio has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Antonio would like to save and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of bananas for his snack-vending business

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
Marylyn is 44 years old; she is married and her spouse adds additional income to the family. She is blessed with seven children.

She has been in her line of business for three years. Her monthly income is 20,000 KES. She wants to buy more stock to be a wholesaler. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

She repaid her previous loan successfully. Her hopes and dreams in the future are to expand the business and have progress in her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 34-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He operates an electronics shop. He has been in this business for seventeen years now. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.
 
This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy materials for electronics spare parts for sale in his shop, and he will use the profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for electronics spare parts

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy merchandise like undergarments to expand her product inventory. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Imelda hopes to have another stall and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like undergarments to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells frozen and processed products for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorna dreams that her business will continue to flourish and have more customers. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carmelita works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling fish.

Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for making the prepared foods, for her food-vending business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-preparing business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Carolina has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF, before this loan.

Carolina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, bread, biscuits, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Celerina has been in this business for 3 years. Celerina earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Celerina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, bread, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Antonina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store.  Antonina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Antonina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is 24 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Juna is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juna has been farming sugarcane for two years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Atanasi

texts.en: Atanasi is a 48-year-old, married man. He has four children, all attending school. He is a teacher by profession. He has been in service for 28 years, and he does farming, as a source of additional income. Atanasi likes the profession. He would like to use the loan to pay school fees for his children. Atanasi is hard-working; however, low and delayed salary payments are challenges he faces.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a twenty-nine-year-old, married man. He has three children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is in the motorcycle transport business, and he engages in cocoa-selling, as another source of income. He has been in business for seven years.

He wishes to buy a second motorcycle for income-generation, though he is challenged by poor roads in the area where he operates. Now, Nicholas needs a loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a hardworking woman who operates a cafe and a motorcycle business. Her previous loan was a big help in her business and she greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business and buy more stock of wheat flour and onions for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business and to buy more stock of wheat flour and onions for her business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase maize, rice, and beans for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase maize, rice, and beans for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her daughter's fees for the upcoming semester.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is 22 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with his family, consisting of his parents and 4 siblings.

Ayman is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems. He is in his 4th year and is only one step away from graduation. He is planning to work in his study field to support his family financially but he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: El Castillo 9 Group

texts.es:
Evelyn es una agricultora del Departamento de La Libertad,ella forma parte del grupo solidario conocido como "El Castillo 9",todos sus miembros se dedican al cultivo de granos basicos.
Evelyn es madre soltera,no tiene grado academico alguno ya que sus padres no podian darle estudio por ser de muy escasos recursos, Evelyn tuvo que trabajar desde una edad muy temprana para ayudar a sus padres y apoyar a sus hermanos menores,tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad ambos estan en la escuela actualmente.
Evelyn tiene 15 años de experiencia en las labores del campo principalmente en el cultivo de granos basicos como maiz, maicillo,frijol, el desempeño en esta actividad le permite tener los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su grupo familiar.
Evelyn solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas que necesita para la produccion de los granos basicos y de esa forma obtener los recursos para seguir brindando estudio a su hijos, pues su deseo es que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, oportunidades que ella nunca tuvo por la falta de recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a farmer in the town of La Libertad in El Salvador.  She forms part of the communal banking group known as "Castle 9."  All of the group members work in growing basic grains.  

Evelyn is a single mother.  She does not have any formal education since her parents were not able to give her that opportunity due to very scarce resources.  She has had to work from the time she was very young in order to help her parents and to support her younger siblings.  She has two children ages 11 and 15. They are both currently in school.

Evelyn has 15 years of experience working in agriculture, principally growing basic grains like corn, sorghum, and beans.  This work allows her to have the necessary resources to sustain her family group.

Evelyn is asking for a loan in order to buy agricultural products that she needs for the production of basic grains and in this way to obtain the income to continue offering an education to her children.  Her desire is that they will have better opportunities in life, opportunities that she never had due to the lack of economic means.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 24 years old, married, and the mother of a lovely kid. She resides in a rural area of Svay Check district, Banteay Meanchey province. She and her husband help each other manage their own farm, which is not far away, about a 10-minute walk from their home. They have been farmers for more than five years, and earn a decent income, which they usually use for daily meals and other living costs. Their primary crop is rice, which is harvested and sold into the market of the province, every harvest season.

Sarom has been an honest client with Hattha Kaksekar for two loans already, and she has never been late on any of her loans. As this is her third loan cycle, she will use the loan funds to build a hygienic latrine, for the sake of her family members. She has not had a proper one before. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special interest rate offered by HKL, Sarom is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the use of her family

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 32 años de edad es casada y junto a su esposo han procreado dos hijas y un hijo de 16 años, 4 años y 14 años respectivamente. Gladys trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante de su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de la familia. Gladys desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda y así poder dar a su familia mejores condicione de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 32, is married and together with her husband have two daughters and one son. They are 16, 4 and 14 years old respectively. 

Gladys works as a cook in a restaurant in her neighborhood which allows her to bring money home and with her husband maintain the household economy. 

Gladys is requesting a loan from FUSAI because she wants to improve the conditions of her house.

She will invest it to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her house and in this way improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-year-old lady.  She is married and has four school going children. She sells raw food items like potatoes, carrots, and maize to her customers in the community. She has been in this business for ten years now.  She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings. 

This is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy more potatoes to sell in her business.  She plans to use the profits to expand the business in order to sell these items at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store for her business.  Dionesia has been in this business for 13 years. Dionesia earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dionesia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Delia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Sherryl

texts.en:
Sherryl is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sherryl has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Sherryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is a married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Marcella has been operating a grinding-machine business at the market, for the past four years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine.

loans.name: Hemazeh

texts.en:
Hemazeh is 20 years old. He lives with his parents and 4 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Rsiafeh. 
Hemazeh is a university student majoring in Business Administration, and he is in his first year. He is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester so he can continue his study and earn his Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep and goats, to raise and sell

loans.name: Juana De La Paz

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años de edad, solo estudio 5º grado esta soltera y solo tiene 2 hijos,  el primero de 17 años, y la segunda niña  de 10 años, el hijo trabaja la agricultura y la niña va  a la escuela  y los dos dependen de ella.


Ella no tiene negocio pero si trabaja de ama de casa en el cantón y con el sueldo que le dan ayuda a sus hijos para la alimentación, la distancia que hay de su trabajo a su casa solo son 4 km su horario es de 7 am a 3 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ropa y abono, fertilizantes, semilla, herbicidas y pesticidas para sembrar maíz. 

su sueño es que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida y que durante su vida ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana, 39, only studied to the 5th grade, she is single and only has two children, the first is a 17-year-old son and then second is a 10-year-old girl. Juana's son works in agriculture and her daughter goes to school, both of them rely on her.

Juana does not have a business but she does work as a housekeeper in the canton and with the money that she makes she is able to help her children with food costs. Juana works at only four kilometers away from her home and her working day is from 7 am to 3 pm.

The loan that Juana is seeking from CREDICAMPO is to buy clothes and manure, fertilizers, seeds, weed killer and pesticides to sow corn.

Juana dreams of her family have a good quality of life and that in her lifetime she is able to help her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fertilizers, manure, seeds, weed killer and pesticides to sow corn.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 20 años, 18 años y 15 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 4 años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y logra dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ana desea solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea cambiar la madera del techo y encementar el piso de la vivienda el cual es de tierra actualmente. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y polines.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and lives in her own home together with her three children aged 20, 18 and 15. Ana has been making her living for the last four years offering domestic services and this is how she supports her household and succeeds in giving her family the best possible living conditions. 

Ana is seeking this loan from FUSAI as she wants to change the wood of the roof and lay down cement on the floor of her home which is current soil. With the sum that she is seeking, she will buy cement, sand, gravel and beams.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and beams to lay cement on the floor of her home and change the wood of the roof.

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a mother of five children (three grown and two at school) and is in her late forties. She is married and has worked at her grocery business from 4:00pm to midnight for six years now. Rukia is able to make a fair profit each month.
 
From Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, this is Rukia's twelfth loan request and she will use it to replenish her business with new inventory (crates of beer, soda, juices and water). She used the previous loans--all of which were paid back successfully--to buy more empty crates, to order more drinks, to buy a fridge and to purchase more demanded drinks.
