Roeurn has been an honest client with Hattha Kaksekar for four loans and always pays her loans on time. She would like to request a new loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. 

She is thankful for this important loan and she is willing to repay all of the money and interest on time.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto, tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, su esposa tiene 50 años de edad, viven junto a sus cuatro hijos de 23, 20, 17  y 13 años de edad. Su negocio consiste en atender a tiempo completo una granja de gallinas ponedoras.
Invertirá el capital en la construcción de una galera para las gallinas, comprara laminas, reglas, clavos, alambre y malla metálica, tendrá los materiales que necesita, sus animales estarán en un lugar más higiénico y aumentara la capacidad en el número de gallinas que posee.
Su aspiración es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio para enseñar a sus hijos el oficio, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y brindarles educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en: Jacinto is 59 years old. He is married and his wife is 50 years old. They have four children, aged 23, 20, 17, and 13.  His business is attending to a chicken egg laying farm full time. He will invest the capital in building a chicken coop. He will buy sheeting, rulers, nails, wire and metallic screens. He will have the materials he needs and his animals will be a more hygienic place. He will increase the capacity of the number of chickens that he has. His goal is to fortify his business so he can teach the trade to his children, improve his family's living conditions and offer a quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, rulers, nails, wore and metallic screens.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with four children; all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing food for the family.

She has operated a food business for  three years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of changing weather conditions in her place of business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business. 

She requests 20,000 KES to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour ,and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a married woman with five children; she works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising livestock.  Amor is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy frozen food to sell.

Amor has sustained her business activities through two previous NWTF loans. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is  to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Santos Aurora

texts.es:
Santos, ha mejorado su vida familiar con los nuevos ingresos que tiene por haber surtido el inventario de su negocio con los productos que sus clientes necesitan, esto es posible por la ayuda que tuvo con el crédito anterior.
Con el fin de continuar manteniendo la estabilidad económica invertirá en abastecer el negocio y mejorar la imagen del establecimiento; comprara una vitrina, jugos, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, jabón, detergentes, aceite, pan, etc.
texts.en:
Santos has improved her family life with the new income that she has from having stocked the inventory of her business with the products that her customers need.  This is possible because of the help she had from the previous loan.

In order to continue maintaining financial stability, she will invest in stocking the business and improving the image of the establishment.  She will buy a display case, juice, basic grains, drinks, candy, soap, detergent, cooking oil, and bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy a display case, juice, basic grains, drinks, candy, soap, detergent, cooking oil, and bread, etc.

loans.name: Aleida Cecilia

texts.es:
Aleida, de 47 años, es madre de 5 hijos a los cuales les ha dedicado gran parte de su vida y esfuerzos.
Ella alterna su oficio de ser mama con su actividad de cría y producción de cerdos de engorde y levante que posteriormente vende en las veredas aledañas y en la plaza del municipio de Montería, Córdoba.
Ella se levanta diariamente en las horas de la mañana para iniciar con sus actividades de porcicultura con la cual obtiene los recursos para la manutención de su hogar.
Ella une sus esfuerzos con sus hijos y de esta manera han logrado constituir un negocio familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más cerdos de cría para aumentar su producción y así poder tener unos ingresos más estables gracias al aumento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aleida is 47 years old. She is the mother of 5 children, to whom she has dedicated a big part of her life and effort. She alternates her work as a mother with her activity of raising and fattening up pigs that she later sells on the nearby streets and in the plaza of the town of Montería, Córdoba.

She gets up every day in the morning to start her pig raising activities to obtain resources to support the home. She unites her efforts with her children's and in this way has been able to build her family business. She is asking for a loan to invest in buying more pigs to increase production and thus have more stable income thanks to the increase in sales.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise to increase production.

loans.name: Otoniel De Jesus

texts.es: Otoniel a sus 22 años se desempeña como dueño de una salsamentaría y es que según él no ha mejor edad para trabajar que la juventud, aprovechar sus ganas y alientos para fortalecer su economía, vende refresco, cervezas, frituras, duces, abarrotes y productos de la canasta familiar siempre persiguiendo un sueño de posicionarse en el barrio como un negocio firme y que permanezca en el tiempo, quiere ampliar su negocio con el que ha mantenido a su familia. A pesar de su corta edad ha demostrado la madurez para afrontar este tipo de retos  por tal razón solicita un auxilio monetario para la compra de surtido desde abarrotes, frituras, refrescos, cervezas con la intención de tener mayor variedad de surtido y crear un fondo propio para surtir la tienda y separar sus ingresos es un hombre soltero sin hijos que solo busca lo mejor para su hogar lo que poco  a poco a logrado con trabajo y esfuerzo
texts.en:
Otoniel, 22, works as the proprietor of a small grocery store. According to him, there is no better age to work than in youth; to take advantage of his desires and wishes to strengthen his finances. He sells sodas, beer, chips, sweets, groceries, and basic commodities always following his dream to situate himself in the neighborhood as a strong business that will remain permanently. He wants to expand the business by which he has maintained his family. Despite his young age, he has demonstrated the maturity to confront these types of challenges. 
For this reason, he is requesting monetary assistance to buy supplies to include groceries, chips, sodas, and beer with the intention of having a greater variety of stock, to create his own funds to supply the store, and to put aside an income. He is a single man without any children who only seeks the best for his home which, little by little, he has accomplished with work and effort.

loans.use: to buy supplies; (beer, sodas, chips, sweets, and groceries).

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz es una madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad que asisten a la escuela, ella trabaja en una finca ordeñando las vacas, cometa que su patrón le permite tener animales en esta finca y  ella cría chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio, Luz aspira que su negocio mejore y sea lo suficientemente rentable para sacar adelante a su hijos y pagar puntualmente su crédito.
texts.en: Luz is a single mother. Her two sons are 7 and 9 years old, and they are both going to school. Luz works on a farm milking cows, and she says that her boss allows her to have animals on the farm, so she is raising pigs. Luz is going to invest her loan in the purchase of pigs to grow her business. She hopes that her business improves and will be profitable enough to help her children get ahead and allow her to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Santiago Fabricio

texts.es: Santiago a su corta edad se dedica al comercio de ganado y también trabaja al jornal en el campo, el vive con su madre y con una hermana  ya que no tiene padre, comenta Santiago que un vecino le enseño el manejo de este negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para venderlos en las ferias de ganado, su aspiración es seguir adelante con este negocio y llegar a ser un gran comerciante de ganado vacuno y también dedicarse y comercializar animales menores.
texts.en: Santiago, at his young age, works selling livestock, and he also earns wages in the field. He lives with his mother and sister as he does not have a father. Santiago says that his neighbor showed him how to manage this business. He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of calves to sell them in livestock fairs. His aspiration is to keep moving forward with his business and to become a great cattle trader. He also wants to start selling small livestock.

loans.use: buy calves.

loans.name: Mov's Group

texts.en:
Mov is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for nine years. The current business earns her family about 98,000 KHR per day to feed the family, and she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Mov with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. Mov, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay to plow the rice field. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to plow the rice field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Edit Marleny

texts.es: Edit gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados en sus cultivos de café los cuales desarrollaron muy bien su función protegiendo la planta, el grano y manteniendo la tierra bien cuidada. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad. Gracias a ello su producción de café dio excelentes resultados logro vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el compromiso con la institución entre otros compromisos que estaban pendientes. Actualmente Edit solicita nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para re-invertir en sus cultivos de café los cuales después de la corta del grano y recolección del mismo quedaron deteriorados y expuestos a ser contagiados por la roya o por plagas que conlleven a la tala de los mismos una vez dañados. Es por esa razón que ella solicita un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprara los abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para cuidar de estos en esta nueva temporada y lograr una mejor cosecha este nuevo año.
texts.en: Thanks to her first loan, Edit was able to buy the necessary fertilizers for her coffee crops, which worked very well, protecting the plant and the seed, and maintaining the soil. Also, she was able to hire qualified laborers who assisted in the sowing and weeding of the land. Thanks to the loan, she had an excellent harvest and sold the coffee beans at a very good price in the market and to middle men in the area. She generated enough income to pay her loan and other outstanding loans she had. Currently, Edit is requesting new support from Kiva lenders to re-invest in her coffee crops that since the cutting of the beans have been deteriorating and are exposed to contracting rust fungus or other plagues that damage the plant so much it must be felled. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy the necessary manure and fertilizer to care for her coffee crops and produce a better harvest this year.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure and other supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nadiegueton F Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON F sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Dramane debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 450.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group NADIEGUETON F are married men, who average 45 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm working during the rainy season. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Dramane, who is standing at the far right in the photo; he intends to use his loan to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 2.5 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at Sikasso markets to a customer base composed essentially of retailers from big cities. He plans on making an average monthly profit of 450,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help the whole family to meet day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Nadiegueton G Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON G sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mahamadou Diakalia debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group NADIEGUETON G are married men, who average 38 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm working during the rainy season. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Mahamadou Diakalia, who is standing at the far left in the photo; he intends to use his loan to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a customer base composed essentially of retailers from big cities. He plans on making an average monthly profit of 350,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help the whole family to meet day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Nadiegueton H Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  NADIEGUETON H sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.  
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mamoutou debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group NADIEGUETON H are married men, who average 43 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Flazambougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm working during the rainy season. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Mamoutou, who is standing at the far left in the photo; he intends to use his loan to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.5 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at Sikasso markets to a customer base composed essentially of retailers from big cities. He plans on making an average monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help the whole family to meet day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame MARIAM débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir :0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  38 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 1 are married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in LANFIALA, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. MARIAM, who is standing in the middle in the photo of this women’s group SABOUGNOUMA 1. With this loan, she intends to purchase some seeds, a 50-kg sack of fertilizer, and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 38,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su madre.
Durante el día trabaja en la empresa San Fernando y por las noches se dedica al transporte de pasajeros de un lugar a otro con un mototaxi que alquila. 
Este joven emprendedor trabaja todo el día para poder ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar.
Una de sus metas es continuar estudiando y convertirse en un gran profesional para dar a su madre todo lo que ella se merece.
Williams está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá remodelar su casa y así tener mayor comodidad y mejorar su nivel de vida.
Gracias Kiva.
texts.en:
Williams is single and lives with his mother in the district of Imperial.

During the day he works at the San Fernando company and at night he drives passengers from one place to another in a mototaxi that he rents.

This young entrepreneur works all day in order to help his mother with the household expenses.

One of his goals is to continue his studies and become a professional so he can give his mother everything she deserves.

Williams is grateful to the Kiva lenders and with the support of a loan he will be able to renovate his home and thus enjoy greater comfort and better quality of life.

Thank you, Kiva.

loans.use: renovate his home.

loans.name: Kim Orn

texts.en:
Kim Orn, aged 36, is married with three children who are in school. Kim Orn operates a farm where she plants and harvest crops to make a living. Her husband helps her manage their farm and earns additional income by providing construction services at sites around Kampong Cham province. Kim Orn has been farming rice for 16 years.

As of now, Kim Orn has requested a loan from Hattha Kaksekar to buy additional seeds and organic fertilizer for this coming rainy season. In the future, Kim Orn would like to improve the general living situation of the entire family and keep developing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and organic fertilizer for this coming rainy season.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  With one child in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Teresa has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like soap, shampoo, toothpaste and other personal items.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, shampoo, toothpaste and other personal items for resale.

loans.name: Tweyambe Mutukula Group

texts.en:
Adija is shown in the photo with her hand raised. She is a fifty-year-old widowed woman  with seven children who livs in Bundibugyo Uganda.

She sells garments for women (commonly known as Bitenge) and has a cocoa business to earn additional income. She has sold clothing since 1989 and it has helped her to educate her children. Her cocoa business is challenged by the changing seasons and competition affects her clothing business. 

She dreams of completing her house and educating her children in good schools. She wants a loan to buy more women's garments to sell.

The photo shows many members who have guaranteed each other but some have not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy women's garments to sell.

loans.name: Maria Merlina

texts.en:
Maria Merlina is a married woman with nine children; sheworks hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Maria Merlina requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ignacio Antonio

texts.es:
Seguir progresando y dejar un buen legado a sus hijos, vivir dignamente y con trabajo hasta el último de sus días son las palabras de Ignacio  un luchador, trabajador, pujante y verraco hombre de 64 años de edad que no solo velo pro el cuidado de sus esposa y 8 hijos, también se preocupó por su futuro tanto así que toda la vida trabajo para adquirir una gran finca con amplios terrenos donde se dedica al cultivo de café, aparte de sus cultivos de café también se dedica a la cría de cerdos actividad que es complementaria con sus cultivos. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para realizar una cosecha de café más productiva que le permita seguir con sus actividades normales del campo e incluso entregar un producto con mayores estándares de calidad.
(la foto aparece junto a su esposa quien ha sido de gran ayuda para todos los logros que ha obtenido a lo largo de su vida)
texts.en:
To keep moving forward and leave a good legacy to their children, to live with dignity and always have work until their last days are the words of Ignacio, a fighter, hard worker, successful, and excellent man of 64 years old, who not only supports his wife and 8 children, but is also concerned for their future. Ignacio has worked his whole life to acquire a large farm with big plots where he cultivates coffee. Apart from his coffee crops, Ignacio also raises pigs. 

Ignacio is requesting a loan to purchase supplies in order to have a more productive coffee harvest that will allow him to continue his normal farming activities and to deliver a product with a better standard of quality. 

He is pictured here with his wife who has helped him achieve all of the accomplishments throughout his life.

loans.use: buy supplies to deliver a coffee crop of higher quality.

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz is a forty two-year-old married man with two children who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

He has a retail shop and also sells cocoa as another source of income to meet his family's basic needs. 

He hopes to build a  permanent house, expand his business into a busy trading center, and educate his children at higher levels. He is limited by a low income and requests  a loan to buy biscuits, soap, sodas, salt, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, soap, sodas, salt, and tea leaves for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren is a 39-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 72,000 KHR per day. 

Saren has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid the loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes to continue growing her rice to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline for her farmland

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Mom is a 33-year-old mother of five dependent children who are all in school. Rice farming is the main source of family’s income, which she and her husband have been in for 17 years.
This is the third micro-loan for Mom’s group with Kiva’s partner and they repaid back the previous loans. Mom has successfully used the loans to better support the family. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Mom, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and the labor to plow her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a greater source of family’s income so as to increase her income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plow for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn, 32, is from a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is married with two children; both are dependents and attend school. 

She and her husband earn a living farming rice. They have been in this business for 14 years. 

Sophorn is in the second cycled  with VisionFund. She formed a new group to ask for a loan and she is the leader, Sophorn is going to use her portion to plow the field. 

She hopes to have a healthy rice crop.

loans.use: to plow the field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame MACHATA assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, de la semence, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group BENKADI 4 are married women, who average 30 years of age and three children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in LANFIALA, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Ms. MACHATA, who is sitting in the middle in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 4. With this loan, she intends to purchase some seeds, a 50-kg sack of fertilizer, and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame SALIMATA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, de la semence, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  52 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group BENKADI 5 are married women, who average 33 years of age and three children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in LANFIALA, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Ms. SALIMATA, who is sitting first from the right in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 5. With this loan, she intends to purchase some seeds, a 50-kg sack of fertilizer, and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and at SIKASSO markets. She plans on making an average profit of 52,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Luchadoras De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “LUCHADORAS DE YANACOT” se encuentran satisfechas por estar  pasando el ciclo 05. Bacilia tiene 52 años de edad es casada con un hijo educando y 04 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a diversas actividades hace 10 años actualmente vende comida frutas pescado en forma ambulatoria. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas pescado para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.  El grupo agradece a Los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Bacilia es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste casca roja.
texts.en: The members of the grupo “LUCHADORES DE YANACOT” ("Yanocot Fighters") are satisfied to be entering into their 5th loan cycle. Bacilia, 52, is married and has one educated child and four dependent children. For 10 years she's been dedicating herself to many activities, but currently she sells fruit and fish on foot. She will invest this loan in more fruit and fish to increase her income. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. In the photo, Bacilia is the one wearing the red jacket.

loans.use: buy more fruit and fish.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame SANAMBA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 2 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  92 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. Most of the women live in traditional families in LANFIALA, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, in Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth farm loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Ms. SANAMBA, who is sitting second from the right in the photo of this women’s group BENKADI 3. With this loan, she intends to purchase some seeds, two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer, and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 92,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her in part to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene muy claro que para conseguir lo que queremos debemos trabajar duro y con mucho empeño. Por eso solicita un préstamo para cumplir un proyecto que tiene de iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas al frente de su casa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de un carrito de comidas, ingredientes como carnes frías, panes, queso y en la compra de instrumentos de trabajo como espátulas y cuchillos.
Todos estos elementos le permitirán consolidar una unidad productiva sostenible y les dará la oportunidad de tener un ingreso adicional para su familia.
Su más grande apoyo es su esposo que la acompaña en todo este proceso.
texts.en:
Yolanda knows very well that in order to get what we want, we should work hard and with great effort. This is why she is requesting a loan in order to carry out a project that started as a business selling fast food in front of her house. Yolanda will invest the money to purchase a food cart, ingredients such as cold cuts, bread, and cheese, as well as utensils like spatulas and knives. 

All of these parts will allow Yolanda to establish a productive, sustainable unit and will give her the opportunity to earn additional income for her family. Yolanda's husband is her biggest supporter and he has been with her throughout this entire process.

loans.use: buy a food cart, supplies such as cold cuts and bread, and utensils like knifes and spatulas.

loans.name: Lorena Gabriela

texts.es: Lorena tiene 24 años de edad, ella vive en la casa de su madre con su esposo que es chofer y sus 3  hijos de 1, 3 y el de 5 años que está en la escuela, Lorena se dedica hace 2 años a la crianza de pollos que los tiene en un corral, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, morochillo y adecuar sus polleras, Lorena aspira mejorar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y asi darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Lorena is 24 years old. She lives in her mother's home with her husband who is a driver, and their three children who are one and three years old, along with their five-year-old who goes to school. Lorena has been raising chickens for two years, and she has them in a pen. She will invest the loan to buy chickens as well as corn to feed and accommodate them. Lorena hopes to improve her business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and cooking seasonings to expand her business

loans.name: Grisel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Grisel, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos los cueles tienen 15 y 9 años de edad, cuando formo su familia junto a su esposo fundaron un negocio de elaboración y venta de antojitos como yuca frita, tostadas, enchiladas, pastelitos entre otros, ya cuentan con 20 años de experiencia, trabajan todos los días de seis de la mañana a  tres de la tarde, su espeso también ofrece servicio de viajes en su vehículo.
Invertirá en la compra de aceite, plátanos, yuca, repollo, tomates, pagara reparación de su coche de venta y el mantenimiento del vehículo que utilizan para realizar los viajes, se limitaran a comprar lo necesario para fortalecer el negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más rentable para cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene así como también apoyar a sus hijos culminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Grisel is married and lives in her own house with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 19.    She and her husband, while starting a family, founded a business of making and selling food including fried yucca, tostadas, enchiladas, small cakes and others.  They can now rely on 20 years of experience, and they work every day from 6 AM till 3 PM.  Her husband also offers the service of trips in his vehicle. 

She will purchase oil, plantains, yucca, cabbage and tomatoes and will pay for repair of her sales cart and maintenance of the vehicle used for the trips.   She will only buy what's necessary to strengthen the business and satisfy her customers.

Grisel's dream is to have a more profitable business in order to fulfill various economic obligations she has and also to support her children in completing college degrees.

loans.use: to buy oil, plantains, yucca, cabbage, and tomatoes, and to pay for repairs to her sales cart and maintenance of their vehicle

loans.name: Jedeliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jedeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing and fishing. Jedeliza is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Jedeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, Yorn is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, while another one is too young for school. The main sources of the family’s income are from growing sesame, which business she and her husband have been in for four years. Now she earns about 60,000 KHR per day to support her family. 
Yorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is applying for a new a loan to pay for the labor fees to plow the field. She hopes to make increase her income so as to have a better standard of living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to plow the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase another water tank in order to keep more water for the house.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Tha is 61 years old and married. As a mother she has struggled to feed her eight children by farming rice and supplementing her income by working as a garment worker. She and her husband have been in the business for 43 years.
Tha is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is now applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce her expenses on motor-taxis.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame ROKIA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  62 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of  the Sabougnouma 2 group are married women averaging 41 years of age, with three children. They live mainly in traditional families in Lanfiala, a village in the township of Loulouni, in the region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural business during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The prior loans have been duly repaid.
They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Rokia does, for example. She is the first one standing from left to right in the group photo. With her loan, she plans to buy one 50-kg [110 lbs] bag of fertilizers and one jug of herbicide as well as pay the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [one acre] of land.
After harvesting, she sells her produce  in her village and in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
She plans to earn an average 62,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This loan will allow her to pay off her loan and  use the rest for helping her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs & pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Yeimy Arely

texts.es:
Yeimy, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la renovación de los estilos, colores y diferentes tallas de las prendas de vestir que tiene a la venta en su negocio comprara faldas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, chores, etc.
Con el financiamiento anterior Yeimy mejoro la variedad de prendas de vestir que ofrece a sus clientes, con lo que sus ventas e ingresos son mayores  las cuales ha utilizado para cancelar su deuda y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Yeimy decided to take out a new loan to invest in the renewal of the styles, colors, and different sizes of the items of clothing that she has on sale in her business. She will purchase skirts, shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, etc.

With the previous loan, Yeimy improved the variety of the items of clothing that she offers to her customers, because of which her sales and income have increased. She has used this increase to pay off her debt and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: comprara faldas, camisas, vestidos, pantalones, chores, etc.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a forty-four-year-old health worker married with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a drug shop business that he started to supplement his  salary and cocoa farming to get enough profits to run his home affairs. He sell drugs to patients around the place and dreams of expanding his business to a big medical center. However, patients who come for treatment want credit and in the end they do not pay. He's also challenged by double taxation that cuts his profits. Ezekiel wants a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Ines Fanny

texts.es: Inés una mujer con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector de alimentos, sus inicios de empresaria independiente fueron aproximadamente hace 9 años donde alquilaba un establecimiento que fue constituyendo gracias al exquisito sabor de sus productos, luego de 9 años de estar ahorrando logro juntar capital suficiente para comprar un negocio el cual podemos ver en la foto el cual aspira y suela en transformarlo en un restaurante muy agradable, solicita un crédito para poder pagar el impuesto de industria y comercio ya que por el alto costo de lugar se quedó sin efectivo y si no realiza oportunamente el pago tendría que renuncia a un sueño que tuvo hace 20 años y el cual fue forjando hace 9 jugando sus ahorros, perder este negocio significaría para Inés una derrota en el mundo del emprendimiento el cual no puede aceptar pues no tiene la manera de reponerse de él.
texts.en:
Inés is a woman with more than 20 years of experience in the food sector. She began as an independent businesswoman about 9 years ago when she rented an establishment that has been successful thanks to the exquisite flavor of her products.

After 9 years of saving, she succeeded in putting together enough capital to purchase a business, which we can see in the photo. She dreams of transforming it into a very nice restaurant.

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay the industry and commercial tax. Due to the high cost of living, she was left without cash. If she does not pay at the appropriate time, she will have to give up a dream that she has had for 20 years and for which she has spent the last 9 years building up her savings. For Inés, to lose this business would mean a defeat in the entrepreneurial world, which she cannot accept because she doesn't have the means to recover from it.

loans.use: to pay industry and commercial taxes to continue operating

loans.name: Enn

texts.en:
Aged 54 years old, Enn is the married mother of three children living in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income and her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 34 years.

Enn has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, sus padres siempre lo llevaban a trabajar desde pequeño, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya viven de forma independiente, aunque siempre le ayudan en su trabajo.



Juan se dedica a trabajar en su panadería desde hace 20 años, negocio que inicio junto con su esposa, ya que ella era empleada en una panadería y ahí aprendió el oficio, todos los días madruga hacer el pan y venderlo durante el día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO  es de 900 dolares para la compra insumos como harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, entre otros para hacer el pan, lo que ayudara a mantener su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 58 years old, studied till 8th grade.  His parents always brought him with them to work even when he was small.  Juan is married and has two children who now live independently, although they always help him in his work.  

Juan has worked in his bakery for 20 years, a business he began along with his wife, since she was employed at a bakery and learned the business there.  Every day he gets up early to bake bread and sell it during the day.

The loan he is seeking from CREDICAMPO is for $900 to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, and eggs for baking bread, which will help him maintain his business and his income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and eggs among other ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Ermitanio

texts.es:
Ermitanio tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos los cuales los dos primeros cursan primaria en el colegio nacional del distrito de Sallique, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es el comercio y cría de ganado vacuno, la compra lo realiza en caseríos aledaños y la venta lo realiza a un comprador de su distrito, tiene una experiencia de 5 años dedicándose a este rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno lecheroy de esta manera poder vender la leche fresca y qeusos que artesanalmente junto a su esposa realizan, son una familia joven que esfuerzan para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ermitanio is 29 years old. He lives in his own home made of rustic materials along with his partner and their two minor children, both of whom are studying in primary school at the national school of the Sallique district. Its populace makes a living from agriculture, commerce, and stockbreeding. It is situated in the Jaen Province that belongs to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

The activity that he performs is commerce and raising cattle. He makes his purchases in neighboring villages and he sells to a buyer from his district. He has 5 years of experience making a living from this trade. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4,500 Nuevo Soles for the purchase of dairy cattle and in this way be able to sale fresh milk and cheeses that he hand crafts along with his wife. They are a young family that strives to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle.

loans.name: Lao

texts.en:
Lao is from the village of Kor, Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is married and has five children. To make a living, she grows and harvests rice crops to sell in the local markets and has been engaged in this business for many years and earns well from these activities. Farming is the primary source of income for her family.

Lao has been with Hattha Kaksekar for one loan already and she successfully repaid it. This will be her second loan, and she will use it to partially renovate her house since it has been deteriorating for many years. She hopes this loan will be granted to her and she promises to repay it on time as scheduled.

loans.use: to partially renovate her house.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en el fortalecimiento de su negocio para continuar teniendo ganancias que le permitirán cancelar sus cuotas y ofrecer a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable, comprara maíz, leña, gas propano, bolsas y cal, para elaborar la venta de tortillas.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo la facilidad para contar con la materia prima con la que se ha mantenido trabajando por una larga temporada.
texts.en:
Dora is requesting another loan to invest in the strengthening of her business, so she can continue making enough money to pay back her fees and offer her family a more comfortable lifestyle. She will purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, bags, and lime expand her tortilla sales.

With the previous loan, she had the resources for the raw material to maintain her business for a long period of time.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, bags, and lime

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is a 32-year-old, married and highly responsible mother of two lovely children. She lives in Tuol Chambak village, Baray commune, Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Sopheak and her husband have been working as farmers for around 10 years. This couple works in the rice field that is located near their house. To support the family expenses, this couple has been working very hard in their rice field, which is the main source of their income.

Sopheak has been a trusted and honest customer of Hattha Kaksekar for one loan already. For this second cycle loan, she will use it to buy a motorbike in order to cooperate her travelling in her homeland and for daily use since she has never had one before. Thanks for this important loan and she is willing to pay back all the money and interest punctually.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cornflower, milk and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Seat, 28, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ou Reang Ov district. She has two children to take care of and now they are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for 10 years and the current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day.

Seat has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Seat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow cassava and rice so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mouykea's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district, Mouykea is 54 years old and married. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young for school. To support the family, she has been growing cassava and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

This is the microloan for Mouykea with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her cassava and she will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming supplies to help her coffee crops during this new season

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoun, 36, is married with three dependent children who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. The main sources of her family’s income are farming rice and growing cassava. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about 25,000KHR per day, and she is able to save about KHR10,000 each day

Sreyoun has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Эту милую и опытную швею зовут Нигина. Ей 40 лет. Она живет у сестры в районе Дангара. Нигина разведена и у нее одна трехлетняя дочь. Для нее ее дочь является смыслом жизни. После неудачной семейной жизни и развода с мужем, ей было очень тяжело, но благодаря дочери она смогла выйти из депрессии и заново начать свою жизнь. 
Нигина зарабатывает на жизнь путем предоставления услуги швеи. Эту деятельность она научилась у своей сестры. Нигина шьет женские платья национального покроя уже 4 года. Ее машинка устарела и она хотела бы обновить ее. Она просит кредит для купли новой швейной машинки. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
This kind, experienced seamstress is named Nigina. She is 40 years old and lives with her sister in the Dangara district. She is divorced and has a three-year-old daughter. Her daughter gives her meaning in her life. Things were very difficult for her after the unsuccessful marriage and divorce, but thanks to her daughter she was able to get out of her depression and restart her life.

Nigina earns a living as a seamstress. Her sister taught her how to sew and Nigina has been sewing traditional dresses for four years. Her sewing machine is outdated and she would like to upgrade it. She requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop to write the reports assigned to her for her work

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice operates a clothes selling business, selling women's and gents' suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: This is Mwanamvua. She previously accessed a loan that she used for her food cafe business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells charcoal. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby clothes and baby chairs to expand her business.

loans.name: Oscar Jeovani

texts.es:
Oscar de 36 años de edad, estudió segundo año de bachillerato, pero por falta de recursos económicos dejo sus estudios, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales solo dos estudian.


Oscar tiene 15 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales de repasto y también trabaja en mantenimiento del sistema de agua potable de su comunidad, para ir a su trabajo viaja 2 kilómetros todos los días.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO  es de 500 dolares para la compra de 2 novillos  para engordarlos en repasto;  con esto podrá tener un ingreso extra, para la alimentación de su grupo familiar.


El sueño de Oscar es ahorrar para construir una vivienda de ladrillo  y darles mucho estudio a sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old. He attended high school until his second year, but left school due to lack of money. He lives with his partner, and he has three children. Only two attend school.

Oscar has 15 years of experience raising animals on pasture. He also maintains his community’s drinking water system. To get to work he travels 2 kilometers every day.

The $500 loan he requests from CrediCampo is to buy 2 young bulls to fatten them on pasture. With this he will have extra income to feed his family.

Oscar’s dream is to save money to build a brick house and to give his children an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 2 young bulls to fatten on pasture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a food cart and raw materials to start his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic soda and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is aged 52 and married. She has four children. Living in a village of the Dambae district, Sambath has been growing cassava and rice. She also supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Having been in business for 10 years, she manages to earn about 42,000KHR per day to feed her family and children. 

Sambath has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the new season.

loans.name: Phalin's Group

texts.en: Phalin is aged 39 and married. She has three children. Living in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Phalin is a rice farmer, while her husband works as a paid worker. Also, having been in a pig business for 21 years, she manages to earn about 35,000KHR per day to feed her family and children. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Phalin wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married with three children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mbodze has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocery business in the future. She also sells fish.

With the loan, Mbodze wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and fish for resale.

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо имеет свой бизнес, ей 39 лет. Она живет в районе Хамадони с мужем и детьми. Муж Нигинамо занимается транспортировкой грузов на грузовой машине КАМАЗ, а дети школьники. Нигинамо сама деятельная и предприимчивая женщина. Она в 2009 году начала свой торговый бизнес по купле и продаже одежды. Нигинамо продает на рынке в основном детскую одежду. Ей нравится ее деятельность. Она хорошо освоила технику продаж и имеет свой индивидуальный подход к каждому клиенту. Нигинамо, чтобы увеличить товарооборот обратилась за кредитом. Она собирается закупить сезонный товар и привести летнюю детскую одежду. Она полагается на поддержку.
texts.en: Niginamo is 39 and has her own business. She lives in the Hamadoni district with her husband and children. Niginamo's husband is a truck driver with KAMAZ and her children are in school. She is an active and enterprising woman. In 2009 she started a business buying and selling clothing. She sells primarily children's clothing at the local market. She loves her work. She has good sales skills and takes an individual approach to her customers. She has requested a loan to purchase seasonal items so that she can sell children's summer clothes and increase her sales. She relies on the support.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's clothing and increase sales

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Una vida junto a su familia fue la que decidió La señora esperanza que a sus 69 años de edad se le conoce como una mujer soltera y sin hijos. Su gran atributo es su sentido de responsabilidad pues quiere retribuirle todo lo que le brindo su madre en la vida por esta razón quiere mantener su negocio estable y busca estrategias para fortalecerlo y constituirlo en el sector por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido como refrescos, empaque de frituras, y variedades que vende en su puesto de trabajo buscando siempre una mayor rentabilidad para llevar un buen bocado a su hogar.
texts.en:
A life with her family was what made Esperanza at 69 years old be known as a single woman without children. Her greatest attribute is her sense of responsibility. She wants to repay all that her mother provided her in life. For this reason, she wants to maintain her business stability and is looking for strategies to strengthen and form it in the area. 

For this reason she is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies such as soft drinks, packaged fried foods, and the assortment that she sells in her store where she works, always searching for more profitability to bring home a good living.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of soft drinks, food, and fried foods, and to increase her supply of tha assortment that she sells to complement her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Eduardo Luís

texts.es:
Eduardo de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, ya que sus padres no tenían para mandarlo a la escuela, siempre se dedico a trabajar, es soltero, vive con sus padres, a quienes les ayuda económicamente para su comida.


Eduardo se dedica a la crianza de animales de repasto y al cultivo de yuca desde hace 6 años, de esto el obtiene ingresos para su comida diaria.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  3 vacas para engordarlas en repasto con esto él podrá tener un ingreso extra, para la comida de su grupo familiar.


El sueño de Eduardo es ahorrar mucho, para construir una vivienda de ladrillo para que su familia tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Eduardo, 24, went to work after he finished grade 5, as his parents lacked the resources to send him to school. He is single, lives with his parents and helps them out economically by paying them for his food. Eduardo's business is the breeding and fattening of cattle. For the last 6 years, he's also been cultivating yuca, which provides him with the income to pay for his daily meals. The loan he is requesting from Credicampo is to buy 3 cows for fattening. This will provide him with extra income for food for his family. Eduardo's hope is to save a lot of money in order to build a brick house so his family will have a worthy home.

loans.use: buy 3 cows for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes, shoes, baby lotions, perfumes, etc., to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana es una joven emprendedora, soltera que vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su familia.
Desde pequeña ayudaba a su madre a trabajar en los campos agrícolas de las diversas zonas de Cañete y desde hace 3 años ya se encuentra incorporada en este trabajo de campo.
Es una chica muy jovial, sonriente y amable que tiene por sueño: “Ser profesional”. Es por ello que con el sueldo ganado paga algunos gastos del hogar y ahorra para en un futuro estudiar una carrera universitaria.
Con esto ella busca apoyar a su familia y ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida para que puedan vivir tranquilos.
Johana está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, para que pueda divertirse un poco luego del largo día de trabajo, sentir mayor comodidad y despertar al día siguiente con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Johana is a young entrepreneur who lives in the District of Imperial with her family. Since she was young she has been helping her mother working in the fields in different areas of Cañete.

Three years ago she joined this field work on her own. She is a happy woman, smiling and friendly who has a dream to be a professional. So with the money she earns she pays some of the household expenses and saves part of it for the future to study at university.

She wants to help her family and provide them with a higher level of living so that they can be comfortable. Johana is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they offer she can buy a TV for her house. Then she can relax a bit after a hard days work, feel more comfortable and get up the next day with desire to go to work and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a resident of Tondo Manila, Philippines. She is 52 years old and she is happily married to Romualdo. God has blessed them with six loving children. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Ludivina owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 PHPs worth of cooking oil, or an egg and others items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she sells it per piece for a higher price to have a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Ludivina desires to help her family especially her grandchildren.  Even at her age, she dreams of having her own car someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman and has five children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has been operating a butcher business, selling various meats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of to purchase more animal meat and for transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase more animal meat and for transportation costs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with children all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 20,000 KES loan, Fatuma wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sindy Vanessa

texts.es:
Sindy Vanessa tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes frutas, verduras y crianza de animales menores, los alimenta con granos naturales de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para el arreglo de una pared de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
Sindy Vanessa is 28 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in the district of Zaña located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to Lambayeque Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this community, which is close to the Jequetepeque River valley, work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.


Sindy sells groceries, vegetables and fruits and raises small animals. She feeds them with natural grains from her district. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1600 PEN to buy construction materials to repair a wall in her house to ensure that she has a safe place to live

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair a wall of her house.

loans.name: Romurica

texts.en:
This is Romurica, aged 61, a resident of Tondo in Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Marcelino, a carpenter, and is the mother of four children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Romurica operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merger of PC (personal computer) rental and arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins in the machine. There is now more need than before for services like these as customers’ demand is increasing. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. Romurica also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation, as well as people who  love to surf the internet and social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum profit of 450 PHP every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Romurica is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional Piso-Net units (computers and supplies) for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Romurica dreams of giving her family a better and sustainable livelihood. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.
