* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional Piso-Net units (computers and supplies) needed in her business.

loans.name: Reina Maritza

texts.es:
Reina, por los buenos beneficios que tiene al invertir créditos en su negocio, se decidió por un nuevo financiamiento para comprar maíz, pollo, aceite, leña, gas propano, verduras condimentos y otros materiales que utiliza para elaborar la venta de tamales y tortillas.
Con el crédito anterior la Sra. Reina ha mantenido la continuidad de su negocio, su situación económica ha mejorado un poco y le permite ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Because of the benefits loans have brought her business, Reina decided to request another loan in order to buy corn, chicken, oil, firewood, propane, vegetables, condiments, and other materials that she uses to sell tamales and tortillas.

With the previous loan Reina has maintained the continuity of her business. Her financial situation has improved a little and has allowed her to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, oil, firewood, propane, vegetables, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm vine, assorted drinks, and cigarettes to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Romain

texts.es:
Romain tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en su propia casa junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a los cultivos de plátano, cacao y palta, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la agricultura, cultiva plátano en una parcela cercana a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Romain is 57 years old, and is a common-law marriage. He lives in his own home with his partner in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a hot climate. His village makes a living through agriculture, especially through banana, cacao, and avocado crops, as well as through commerce and cattle. The community is located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region, along the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living through agriculture, and he cultivates bananas on a piece of land close to his home. He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizers for his banana crop to generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to maintain his banana crop.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken is 35 years old, and a married woman with five children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have been  farmers for around 20 years. They work in the rice field that is located not so far from their house. Their primary crop is rice, which is harvested and is sold into the market of the province every harvest season.

Ken has been a honest client with Hattha Kaksekar for one loan already, and she has never been late on any loans. 

This time, she would like to get new loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming. 

With this loan, she hopes that she can afford fertilizer and seeds to use for this growing season on time. 

Thanks for this important loan; she is willing to pay back all the money and interest punctually.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil soltera vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, en su propia casa junto con su madre; la comunidad donde residen se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a aprestar servicio como mototaxista desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente, también se dedica a las ventas de soya, avena, pan, por las mañanas, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 900 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos como aceite y lubricantes de su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 39 years old, single and lives in her own house with her mother. They live in Cayaltí district located in the Province of Chiclayo which belongs to Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this community work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Raquel has offering service as a motorcycle taxi for more than 5 years. She also works selling soya, oats and bread in the mornings. She is an enterprising mother. She has requested a loan of 900 PEN to buy spare parts like oil and lubricants for her vehicle and in this way make more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, oil and lubricants for her vehicle.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 29 years old. He is married with three children, all of whom go to school. 

He will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production. 

He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Thuweiba

texts.en:
Thuweiba operates a tailoring business. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She appreciates the support of the previous loan.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Thuweiba wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a resident of Tondo in Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Richard and together they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, they are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maricel operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like bananas which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Aside from this, Maricel cooks and sells street food for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantity and variety of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Maricel dreams of supervising a bigger business than that of a fruit vendor. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantity and variety of fruit to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards as it enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. In addition to the retail shop business, she sells charcoal.

Mwanakombo would like to apply for a loan to buy more stocks of charcoal, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe has operated a pub business to earn a living. Her potential clients are her fellow villagers. She dreams of establishing a bar in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase crates of beer and soft drinks for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business; she appreciates for the support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, sardines, sugar, and biscuits to expand her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, a sus 61 años de edad aun conserva el patrimonio de sus padres que es haberle enseñado a cultivar maíz y hoy en día es el medio con el que obtiene los ingresos para salir a delante con su familia, con el paso del tiempo aprendió lo relacionado con la crianza de cerdos y la albañilería. José vive con su esposa de 51 años de edad.
El capital que requiere lo utilizara para fortalecer su negocio, ampliar la aérea de siembra, protegerá su cultivo, tendrá producto suficiente para la alimentación de su familia y poder comercializar, se comprara fertilizantes, semilla, plaguicidas, insecticidas y concentrado para cerdos. 
Su sueño es tener más ingresos para cancelar su deuda y cubrir sus necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
José, at 61 years old, still preserves the heritage of his parents, who taught him to cultivate corn. Now that is how he earns the income that advances his family. Over time he learned the related skills of raising hogs and construction work. José lives with his wife, who is 51 years old.

He will use the loan to strengthen his business by buying fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and food for hogs. He will expand the area he sows, protect his crops, and have enough to feed his family and to sell.

His dream is to have more income to repay his debt and cover his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and food for hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 39, is a resident of Mongkul Borey district located in the Banteay Meanchey province. She is also a mother of three kids, two of whom still count on her. For her entire household, rice cropping and fish selling business are the main source of income. This business generates her about 35,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Sary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans completely and they have enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking for 300,000 KHR from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).   It is the same loan amount as her joint borrower. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a casting net to catch more fish for resale. She strongly believes that the loan will unlock a way for her to earn a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a casting net to catch more fish for resale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea is a forty-year old married woman, mother of one little daughter, and a resident of Prey Chhor district located in Kampong Cham province,  She strives for a living via rice farming and her paid-working job as a construction worker.

This is the first time that she is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Chea is a group leader of a group of two members. She is facing a problem on her farm as there is not enough rain and also there are insects that ruin her crop. She plans to take a loan of 700,000 KHR in order to buy pesticide and fertilizer to use on her farm. She strongly hopes that the loan enables her to continue her farming business so that she can earn money for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to use on her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Rotha is a 40-year-old resident of Cheung Prey district, located in the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children; one child is dependent on her. 

Rotha struggles to earn a living for her family by rice farming; it is the business that she has had for 22 years. In order to earn extra income for her family, Rotha also works as a factory worker. On average, her family can make about $5 per day, which is barely enough to pay daily expanses. 

This is the first cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and cows in order to continue her farming business. 

She optimistically believes that the loan will enable her to earn a higher income and help her to uplift the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and cows

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Saem is age 46 years and married. She has eight children. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and fishing for 20 years. To supplement the income, they also work for others for a fee.

Saem has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans.

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is a resident of Srey Snom district located in Siem Reap province. She is a forty-eight-year old married woman who needs to work hard to support her four dependent kids. In order to earn a living to support her family, she has been farming (rice) for 23 years. She also raises pigs for sale to generate extra income for the family. The average income for the whole family is about 14,000 KHR per day, which is barely enough to buy food for her children. 

This is the first cycle for Sorn to seek a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sorn is in need of financial support to keep her children in school; therefore, she is applying for the loan to cover the school fees for her son, who is pursing a bachelor degree majoring in Tourism Management. She strongly hopes that this financial aid will help her son, so he can focus on his studies and achieve good academic performance.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her son

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Salath's Group

texts.en:
Salath is the leader of this group, which is applying for a 3,200,000 KHR loan through Vision Fund. A resident of Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, she is forty years old and blessed with four children. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and selling bananas. She earns about 16,800 KHR a day, which is barely enough to support a family of four children.

This will be Salath’s fourth loan cycle and the first for her co-borrowers. She successfully repaid these previous loans that have helped her to improve her livelihood at a gradual rate. As a leader, she will spend her 1,400,000 KHR loan portion to pay plowing fees and buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can continue to replant and so boost her yield over time.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Malak Group

texts.en:
This group is called Malak. It is comprised of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Samia is the leader of the group. She is a 40 years old married woman and has 8 children. Her oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest one is a year and a half old. She lives with her family in their own house. Samia works as a housewife and she is a very dynamic woman. Her husband is an employee in the public sector. The salary that he receives from his work is small, and it is not enough to cover the expanses of their house. Their house is very small, and it consists of two rooms and one bathroom and the kitchen is outside of the house. This affects Samia negatively and she feels ashamed especially if she is carrying the food from the kitchen to the house because the kitchen is outside of the house. For this reason, Samia applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen inside the house.

Samia hopes to renovate her house in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen inside the house

loans.name: Katherin

texts.es:
Katherin es madre soltera, vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su menor  hijo quien es su orgullo y por quien trabaja incansablemente.
Desde el 2010 trabaja en los campos agrícolas de las diversas zonas de Cañete en el cultivo de mandarina.
Esta joven quiere sacar adelante a su hijo, es por ello que sale muy temprano a trabajar y deja al niño en el colegio. Por las tardes le ayuda con las tareas y juega con él. 
Sin duda alguna es una madre ejemplar, su más grande sueño es: “Darle una buena educación a su hijo y mejorar su nivel de vida”. 
Katherin está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda y de esa manera sentirá mayor seguridad dentro de su hogar.
texts.en:
Katherin is a single mother. She lives in the district of Imperial with her young son who is her pride and joy and for whom she works tirelessly. Since 2010 she has worked in the fields in the Cañete area growing mandarin oranges.

Katherin wishes to help her son get ahead in life so she leaves for work early in the morning after dropping him off at school. In the afternoons she helps him with his homework and plays with him. There is no doubt that she is an exemplary mother. Her greatest wish is to give him a good education and improve their standard of living.

Katherin is grateful to Kiva donors as it is with their help that she will be able to make improvements to her house so that she will feel safer when she’s at home.

loans.use: make improvements to her house so she feels safer

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is 55 years old, married and the mother of four lovely children. She resides in a rural area of Svay Check district in Banteay Meanchey Province. An and her husband help each other to manage their own farm, which is not far away from their home. They have been farmers for more than 25 years and earn a decent income of around $5 per day. Their primary crop is rice which is harvested and sold in the province's market every harvest season.

An is an honest client who has been carefully selected by Hattha Kaksekar (HKL)’s credit officer. An will use this loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members as she has not had a proper latrine before. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, An has been encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard her family's health and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 43 years old and he lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Gagik has become a very good client of Nor Horizon and of Kiva as well. This will be his second loan from Kiva. The first loan he used on the development of his beekeeping in which he is still seriously engaged. In the village Nerkin Hand he has 70 beehives and during a year his bees give nearly 900 kilogram of pure, healing and tasty honey. He also has a plot of land the cultivation of which gives him a harvest of beans, potatoes, cucumbers, and tomatoes. He sells all his farm goods at Kadjaran, Kapan and sometimes also in the Yerevan cities.
 
Gagik is married and has two daughters; the eldest is employed and his second daughter already is a student (at the paid division). 

This time Gagik wants a loan to purchase paper, frames, and special medicine for his bees.

loans.use: to purchase paper, frames, and special medicine for his bees

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
This is Nelinda, aged 43, a resident of Tondo in Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Emilio, a company driver, and is the mother of five children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelinda operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs ranging from round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She also collects used boxes and sells them for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her to continue operating her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, needles and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nelinda hopes for an increase in her daily profit and dreams of setting up other businesses so that she will be able to buy their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 54 years old and she lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. She has a vocational medical education, and for several years she worked as a nurse. She is married and has a daughter. Susanna’s husband now works in Russian Federation, and from there he transfers money for his family. 

Susanna now is engaged in farming and agriculture; she breeds 2 cows, a heifer, 4 sheep, 2 pigs and 30 chickens on her farm. On her plot of land, she cultivates potatoes and sells it at the city wholesale market. As she says, it is very hard for her to do all the farming alone, and also to arrange the sale of her farm products, but there is no other way, since her husband’s income is not constant and not enough for their family. Also, their daughter is going to get married and little by little, they must get ready for the costs of wedding.

Susanna needs this loan in order to develop her farming and agriculture. The income will help her to begin to save some money. 

With this loan, she will buy animal fodder for her farm cattle, and also potato seedlings.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and potato seedlings

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 35, married, and has five children. She will use a Kiva loan to pay labor costs and purchase fertilizer for the maize harvest.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs for the maize harvest

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco, age 41, is married and has four children. He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizer for the maize harvest.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during the maize harvest

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 29 years old, married and has one child. He is a maize farmer who is applying for a 1,322,803 RWF loan through UOB to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his crops. He plans to invest his farming profits in his farm so that in the future he can buy farm machinery and a tractor, which will help increase his yield.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 33 years old and the father of three children. He is a maize farmer who is applying for a 1,322,803 RWF loan through UOB to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his crops. He plans to invest his profits in his farm so that in the future he can buy farm machinery and a tractor, which will help increase his yield.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is age 35. She is a mother of three, all of whom go to school. 

She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old. She is married with five children. 

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 32 years old; she is a mother of two. 

She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married and the mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Wilian Alexi

texts.es:
Wilian de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3° año contador, actualmente está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, ya que tiene que pasar más tiempo en su casa cuidando a su hijo quien el próximo año comienza su formación académica en kínder.  

Él se dedica a la cría de cerdos y a la agricultura, se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos desde hace unos 15 años,  porque cuando vivía con sus padres noto que ellos tenían un ingreso con la venta de ellos. él decidió también emprender este rubro para ir teniendo una fuente de ingreso aparte del trabajo de la agricultura que realiza junto a su padre y hermano. 

Wilian tiene que caminar desde su casa hasta sus cultivos todos los días,  se tarda de 25 a 30 minutos en llegar, esto es todos los días,  mientras tanto su esposa se dedica a cuidar de la casa y de los cerdos.

Con el crédito comprara abonos y herbicidas para sus cultivos y poder aplicarlos a tiempo para tener una buena producción de granos básicos, con esto podrá tener como alimentar a su familia y también granos para darles de comer a los cerdos para que cuando los venda sea a un buen precio, también comprara un saco de concentrado para los mismos para que su engorde sea más rápido.

Él espera que en el futuro pueda hacer más grande su casa, donde pueda ver a su hijo crecer como una persona de bien en la comunidad, que sea muy respetado por los demás, espera que sus esfuerzos que está realizando sean bien aprovechados por él, también  espera que su producción de maíz y frijol sea muy abundante y tenga los granos básicos para su familia y que a ellos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Wilian is 33 years old, and he studied through the third grade. He is currently in a relationship, and his wife takes care of the household chores, because she has to spend more time at home taking care of their son, who will begin his schooling next year in kindergarden. 

He works raising pigs and in agriculture, and he has made a living by raising pigs for more than 15 years. When he lived with his family, he noticed that they received an income by selling pigs. He also decided to start a business to have a source of income aside from the agricultural work that he does with his father and his brother.  

Wilian has to walk from his house to the fields every day, and it takes him 25 - 30 minutes to arrive. Meanwhile, his wife takes care of their home, and the pigs. 

With this loan, he will buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crops to be able to apply them with enough time to have a good basic grain crop. With this, he will be able to feed his family, and he will have grains to feed his pigs so that he can later sell them for a good price. He will also buy a sack of concentrated feed for the pigs so that they will fatten up more quickly. 

He hopes that in the future, he can make his house bigger, where he can watch his son grow up to be a good person in the community, who is respected by others. He hopes that the efforts that he is making now will be worth it. He also hope that his corn and bean crops will be abundant, and that he will have basic grains for his family, so that they will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides for his crops, and concentrated feed to feed his pigs.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame NABINTOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  62 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the "Sabougnouma 3" group are married women. On average, they are 35 years old, have four children, and live in traditional families in Lanfiala in the Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sustain their farming business during the rainy season. 

This is their 10th farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their past loans have been repaid. They plant peanuts with Madame Nabintou, who is second from the left in this photo of Sabougnouma 3.

With this loan, she will buy one 50kg bag of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide. She will also pay for plowing for 0.5 hectares.

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the village in the markets of Sikasso. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele comprised of men and women.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 62,000 FCFA per season. Part of her loan will her pay the loan and interest. The rest will be used to help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is 34 years old. He is married and has spent five years in the maize production. He will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer for the maize harvest.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs for the maize harvest

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, ha tenido un efecto positivo al invertir el crédito anterior en la tienda, su nueva situación económica le permite mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y cancelar las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
En esta oportunidad Olga solicita un nuevo préstamo para surtir  la tienda y aprovechar la época de invierno para sembrar maíz, comprara bebidas, golosinas, azúcar, sal, huevos, aceite, pan e insumos agrícolas (herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono, insecticidas y semilla).
texts.en:
Olga invested her previous loan in stock for her store and has felt the benefits from this investment. Her new economic situation has allowed her to improve her family’s standard of living and pay off debts.

Now she is seeking another loan to buy stock for her store and to plant corn now that winter has arrived. She wishes to buy drinks, candy, sugar, salt, eggs, oil, bread and agricultural supplies (herbicides, insecticides, manure, and seeds).

loans.use: buy drinks, candy, sugar, salt, eggs, oil, bread and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This young and nice lady’s name is Ani and she is 23 years old. She lives in Yerevan city with her family. Ani has a brother and sister. They are twins who are still school-aged. Ani graduated from Tourism and Service State University with the specialty of tour manager. Now she is employed, but not in her specialty. She works at a private company as a sales assistant. As she says she is very happy to have this work, through which she manages in her turn to help her partners to solve their family financial problems, but she greatly wishes and hopes that one day she will finally find some job in her specialty, since she finds it a very interesting perspective and profitable.

Ani is asking for this loan since she greatly wants to buy a computer, with which she will learn a special program that tour managers use and arrange her work. With this loan amount she also wants to furnish her bedroom, which is still not furnished after its repair.

loans.use: to buy a computer to learn a special program and also to furnish her bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sweet potatoes and greens for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.ru: Мохинисо замужняя женщина в возрасте 35 лет. Она имеет сына и троих дочерей. Муж Мохинисо работает учителем в местной сельской школе. А Мохинисо уже год как занимается растениеводством на приусадебном участке земли. В данный момент на ее землях посеяна пшеница. Пришло время обработать их минеральными удобрениями. Так как у Мохинисо нет собственных средств, она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести необходимые минеральные удобрения. Она нуждается в этом кредите, поскольку хочет собрать качественный урожай пшеницы.
texts.en: Mohiniso is a married woman of 35. She has a son and three daughters. Her husband works as a teacher in the village school and she has been growing crops on a personal plot of land for a year. Right now she has wheat planted, and the time has come to fertilize the soil. Since she doesn't have the money she is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She needs this loan in order to receive a good harvest of wheat.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for the wheat harvest

loans.name: Mahtob

texts.ru: Махтоб жительница района Хамадони. Она живет вместе с родителями, так как она одинокая незамужняя женщина. Ей уже 41 год. Она работает уборщицей в сельской больнице. Параллельно Махтоб еще и занимается растениеводством. Эту деятельность она начала год назад. Махтоб выращивает на земле пшеницу и овощи. Она уже посеяла картофель, помидор и пшеницу, теперь для их обработки ей необходимо закупить минеральные удобрения. Для этой цели она просит кредит и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mahtob is 41 and a resident of the Hamadoni region. She is not married and lives with her parents. She works as a janitor in the village hospital and also in agriculture, an occupation she started a year ago. She is growing wheat and vegetables on her land and has already planted potatoes, tomatoes and wheat. Now, to help them grow, she needs to buy mineral fertilizers. For this goal she is requesting a loan and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to improve the soil

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Majala

texts.en:
Majala is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food items of maize flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Majala dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
El arte del polarizado es una práctica y un oficio muy poco común en Cereté, municipio de Córdoba pero que poco a poco va tomando fuerza en el mercado de los automóviles.
Paula es una joven simpática y muy trabajadora que se ha dedicado a capacitarse y dedicarse a este oficio, tanto así que hoy en día tiene un pequeño negocio de instalación de vidrios polarizados en automóviles, ventanas y vidrios de algunos almacenes. Este oficio lo aprendió en Barranquilla al lado de sus primos quienes le enseñaron a trabajar y la motivaron a independizarse.
Solicita un crédito para capitalizar su negocio y darle más fuerza a su actividad permitiéndole consolidar su negocio de una manera rentable. El dinero será invertido en la compra de materia prima como cintas y adhesivos polarizados.
Esto le permitirá cubrir una mayor parte del mercado pues tendrá los elementos necesarios para trabajar.
Ella es una mujer joven y con todas las ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Polarizing windows is a uncommon practice and business in Cereté in the municipality of Córdoba, but little-by-little  it is becoming more common in the automobile market. 

Paula is a nice, hardworking, young woman who teaches and practices this trade. Currently, she has a small business that installs polarized windows in automobiles and windows and glass in some stores. She learned this trade in Barranquilla  alongside her cousins who taught her the trade and inspired her to work independently. She is applying for a loan to invest in her business and strengthen it and make it more profitable. The money will be invested in the purchase of basic materials like tape and polarized adhesive sheets. This will enable her meet most demand since she will have the materials that she needs in order to work. She is a young woman with the desire to move forward.

loans.use: To buy basic materials like tape and polarized adhesive sheets in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle so she can more easily deliver orders and extend her territory

loans.name: Sabougnouma 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame KADIATOU débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  52 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the "Sabougnouma 3" group are married women. On average, they are 43 years old, have four children, and live in traditional families in Lanfiala in the Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sustain their farming business during the rainy season. This is their 10th farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their past loans have been repaid. 

They plant peanuts with Madame Kadiatou, who is standing in the middle of the back row in this photo of Sabougnouma 4. With this loan, she will buy one 50kg bag of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide. She will also pay for plowing for 0.25 hectare. After the harvest, they sell their crops in the village in the markets of Sikasso. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele comprised of men and women.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 52,000 FCFA per season. Part of her loan will her pay the loan and interest. The rest will be used to help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Evelio Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Evelio se dedica al expendio de carne en una pequeña chaza ubicada en al municipio de Cotorra, Córdoba. Desde allí atiende su negocio todos los días. Inicio su negocio como alternativa para la obtención de unos mejores ingresos ya que en ese momento tenía un hijo en camino y quería darle todo lo mejor y que nunca le faltara nada.
Hoy en día tiene su negocio muy reconocido, tanto así que en muchas ocasiones no da abasto con sus ventas, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para comprar dos vacas, extraer su carne y de este modo aumentar su oferta dándose la oportunidad de vender una mayor cantidad de carne y aumentar sus ingresos.
El es un hombre con buen sentido del humor y excelente fuerza de trabajo.
texts.en:
Evelio works selling meat in a small food stall located in the municipality of Cotorra, Córdoba. From there, he tends to his business every day. He started his business as an alternative for obtaining better income since at that time, he had a child on the way and he wanted to give it the best and hoped that it would lever lack anything.

Today, his business is very well-known, so well that on many occasions he hasn't been able to keep up with his sales. Therefore, he is applying for economic support to buy two cows, take their meat and, in this manner, increase his offering. This will give him the opportunity to sell a better quantity of meat and increase his income.

He is a man with a good sense of humor and excellent work ethic.

loans.use: to buy two cows to take their meat and sell it.

loans.name: Al- Ma 22 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Ma 22. It consists of five women, from Taiz, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 340,000 YER from AMB.

Huda is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of four children, living in a rented house in Taiz, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Huda's husband is an employee in the private sector and earns a small salary. Huda studied till the Elementary school. She couldn't complete her studies, but she is a very dynamic and active woman. Huda works as a housewife. She has a lot of house work. Her house lacks many home appliances such as a washing machine. Huda always washes the family's clothes by hand. This work makes her very tired.  She asked her husband to buy a washing machine for the house. Unfortunately, her husband's income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Huda applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB, in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes, as well as to purchase other home appliances.

Huda looks forward to furnishing the house for her family. Also, she hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes, as well as to purchase other home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water, candy, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, sugar, candy, soap, etc., for her business

loans.name: Zuhroi

texts.ru: Зухрои уроженка района Хамадони, ей 23 года. Она уже замужем, но детей пока не имеет. Ее муж работает в арматурном заводе. Зухрои сама трудится на орошаемом участке земли. Она в течение 5 лет занимается посевом зерновых и огородных культур. Зухрои берет кредит для обработки урожая пшеницы и для посева овощей. На сумму кредита она хочет закупить минеральные удобрения и семена овощей. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку для продолжения деятельности.
texts.en: Zuhroi is 23 and a resident of the Hamadoni region. She is married but doesn't have any children yet. Her husband works in a factory and she works in agriculture. For five years she has been growing grain and market crops. Zuhroi is requesting a loan so she can improve the soil and plant vegetables. She intends to buy mineral fertilizers and vegetable seeds. She hopes for financial support to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда жительница района Рудаки. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем за шофера. Ее муж занимается перевозкой пассажиров по маршрутной линии района. Дочери 16 лет, а сыну 13 лет. Они учатся в школе. Умеда по профессии швея. Она у себя дома открыла ателье и занимается пошивом женской национальной одежды. Она занимается швейным делом уже 5 лет и сейчас решила расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит для купли новой швейной машинки. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: Umeda is 36 and a resident of the Rudaki region. She is married and her husband works as a driver on the region's bus routes. Her daughter is 16 and her son is 13; they both go to school. Umeda is a tailor by profession. She opened a studio at home and works sewing women's national clothing. She has been earning a living sewing for five years and has now decided to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru: Бибигул 55 летняя жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем. У мужа имеется грузовая машина, он предоставляет услуги по перевозке больших грузов. У них совместно 5 детей. Старший сын находиться за рубежом на заработках. Бибигул настоящая сельская женщина. Она занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Каждый год она сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры, и параллельно занимается куплей продаже скотин. Она покупает бычка и после длительного откорма перепродает его с наценкой. Бибигул решила расширить бизнес и купить сразу несколько телят и бычков. Она надеется таким ходом она увеличить свои доходы, что сможет покрыть многие семейные затраты. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibigul is a 55-year-old married resident of the Hamadoni region. Her husband has a truck and offers services transporting large cargo. They have five children; their oldest son is working abroad. Bibigul is a real country woman who works in animal husbandry and farming. Every year she raises crops and at the same time buys and sells cattle. She buys steers and, after fattening them, sells them for a profit. 

Bibigul has decided to expand her business and buy a few calves and steers. She hopes in such a way to increase her income, which will help her cover more of her family's expenses. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a few calves and steers

loans.name: Bakhtigul

texts.ru: Бахтигул из маленького района Носири Хисрава 39 лет. Она мама троих детей. Дети учатся в школе. Муж находится в в Российской Федерации на заработках. К сожалению он не нашел в маленьком районе работу и уехал, чтобы прокормить семью. Бахтигул сама около 13 лет работает учительницей в местной школе. Но ее зарплата маленькая, чтобы обеспечить детей. Она дополнительно дома занимается куплей продажей скотин. Она начала заниматься деятельностью животноводства 5 лет назад. Такой малый бизнес приносить не большой доход, но помогает покрывать многие финансовые проблемы. Бахтигул покупает теленка и после длительного откорма продает его на скотном рынке. На сегодняшний день Бахтигул решила купить расширить не большой бизнес. Она намерена получить кредит и приобрести пару телят для откорма и продажи. Она надеется такими темпами она сможет решить больше финансовые проблемы. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
Bakhtigul is 39 and from the small region of Nosiri Khusrav. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is working in Russia. Unfortunately he was unable to find work in their region and had to leave so he could feed his family. Bakhtigul has been working as a teacher in the local school for about 13 years, but her salary is too small to cover the costs of taking care of her children. She earns extra money by buying and selling livestock, a business she began five years ago. Such a small business doesn't bring in a lot of revenue, but it helps to cover a lot of financial needs. She buys calves and, after fattening them, sells them at the cattle market. 

Now she has decided to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy two calves for fattening and resale. With this she hopes to be able to solve bigger financial problems. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Shirinmoh

texts.ru: Ширинмох молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 26 лет. Она из села района Хамадони. У нее одна маленькая дочь. Ее муж мастер строитель. Ширинмох по природе усердная, энергичная женщина. Около 10 лет она занимается животноводством. Ширинмох разводит маленьких бычков. В течение месяца она откармливает их и затем по прибыльной цене продает на скотном рынке. Сейчас у нее имеется только один бычок и поэтому она хотела бы увеличить его поголовье. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Shirinmoh is a young married woman of 26 from a village in the Hamadoni region. She has one little daughter. Her husband is a skilled construction worker. Shirinmoh is by nature a diligent, energetic woman. She has been working in animal husbandry for about 10 years, raising young steers. Over a month's time she fattens them and then sells them at the cattle market for a profitable price. Right now she only has one steer and therefore she wants to increase her head count. With this goal in mind she is requesting a loan. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy steers to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Wairobi

texts.en:
Wairobi is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as focused and determined. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes wooden chairs, tables, beds, and other items for sale. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy carpentry materials to make furniture. His business goal is to open more branches of his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more nails, locks, hinges, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives with his wife in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region of Armenia.  His own two children are already married and living separately with their families.  He has a higher education background in mathematics and now works at the school as a teacher of mathematics.  He is a very clever and interesting person and his pupils like the way that he arranges his lessons and his methods of teaching.  He also has some pupils he prepares for entrance examinations through private courses he prepares.  

Ashot likes his pedagogical occupation, especially his everyday contact with children, and he says that nowadays, children are extremely clever, brainy, and inquisitive.  Despite of having many years of pedagogical experience, he constantly develops himself and tries to be aware of any news, not just in the sphere of mathematics, but also in different fields that may interest the children.

Ashot requested a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy a computer and some methodological literature, which he greatly needs both at the school and during his courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some methodological literature.

loans.name: Abdharah

texts.en:
Abdharah is 28 years old, and married, with two children.  He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, coal, and oil for her business

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул продавщица на рынке своего района Спитамен. Она начала свою торговую деятельность в 2012 году и уже два года продолжает свой бизнес. Хаитгул 45 лет. Она мать четверых детей и воспитывает их одна без мужа. Старший сын работает строителем, старшая дочь работает в государственном предприятии, а младшие дети еще учатся. Сама Хаитгул продает на рынке овощи. Ее товар всегда востребован. Она хочет сейчас привезти больше товара и увеличить товарооборот. С такой целью Хаитгул берет кредит для купли партии овощей. Она ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Haitgul is a salesperson in the market of her region of Spitamen. She started her retail business in 2012 and has been keeping it going for two years. She is 45 and the mother of four children whom she is raising without a husband. Her oldest son works in construction, her oldest daughter works in a government company, and the younger children are still in school.

Haitgul sells vegetables at the market. Her goods are always in high demand. She wants to bring in more inventory and increase her turnover. With this goal in mind she is requesting a loan to buy a shipment of vegetables. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sabougnouma 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame MARIAM assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  39 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The  seven members of  the Sabougnouma 5 group are married women averaging 44 years of age, with three children. They live mainly in traditional families in Lanfiala, a village in the township of Loulouni, in the region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural
They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Mariam does, for example. She is the first one seated from right to left in the group photo. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds, one 50-kg [110 lbs] bag of fertilizers, and one jug of herbicide as well pay the cost of labor to work 0.25 ha [0.5 acre] of land.
After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village and at the markets of Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
She plans to earn an average of 39,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This loan will allow her to pay off her loan and use the rest to assist her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Bimalika

texts.ru:
Ей 60 лет. Ее зовут Бималика. Она жительница не большого района Хамадони. Бималика вдова, она потеряла своего мужа и вырастила троих дочерей. 
Бималика начала деятельность животноводства 5 лет назад. Ей нравиться заниматься куплей продажей скотин, и она хочет продолжить заниматься этим бизнесом. Бималика считает, что набралась достаточного опыта работы, чтобы расширить малый бизнес и перейти на новый уровень. С такими мыслями и идеями она обратилась за кредитом. Бималика ранее покупала одного теленка кормила его и после перепродавала его с наценкой. Теперь она хочет заниматься выращиванием скотин. Она верит и надеется, что у нее все получиться и ее бизнес получить успех.
texts.en: Bimalika is 60 and a resident of the small region of Hamadoni. She is a widow and has raised three daughters. Five years ago she started an animal husbandry business. She likes buying and selling cattle and wants to continue with it. She believes that she has gained enough experience to expand her small business and bring it to a new level. She is requesting a loan with these thoughts and ideas in mind. Previously, Bimalika bought one calf, fattened it and then sold it for a profit. Now she wants to raise even more cattle. She believes and hopes that she will have success in this business.

loans.use: to buy calves and steers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm nuts for the production of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients such as rice, oil, pepper, fish, meat, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty-year-old widowed female with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a retail shop and also gets income from rentals and cocoa farming.

Mary has been in this business since 1990 and it has helped her to cater for her family to the required standards of living. She dreams of expanding her business to a bigger trading centre and having many outlets, although she is limited by capital. Mary needs a loan to buy soap, steel wool, salt, sugar, sweets, and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, steel wool, salt, sugar, sweets, and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to nurture her coffee plants.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.es:
Juvencio tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la producción y venta de plátano actividad que realiza hace más de 05 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono y pago por mantenimiento de su parcela de plátano y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Juvencio is 51 years old and lives with his partner in the Buenos Aires district. The main industries in the area are agriculture, cattle-raising, and trade. It has basic amenities such as water and electricity, and is located in the Morropon Province, which is part of the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru. He works growing and selling bananas, and has been doing this for over five years. He is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer and to pay for the maintenance of his banana plantation and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his banana crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two washing machines and a dryer.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is aged 29. She is married with two children aged between two and five. Claudine will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer needed for maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming Claudine wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs needed for the production of maize.

loans.name: Jesus Arturo

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de un veterano de la vida que ha pasado por múltiples problemas a lo largo de su vida pero que ha podido resolver y superar cada uno de ellos permitiendo adquirir gran experiencia y sabiduría.
El es Jesús y es un hombre dedicado y muy trabajador que hace aproximadamente 7 años se atrevió a montar una tienda de abarrotes en una vereda del municipio de Chigorodó con el afán de aumentar sus ingresos. Después de esto tuvo que pasar por ciertos problemas familiares que lo obligaron a cerrar su negocio por largo tiempo para luego volverlo a retomar y tratar de sacar adelante con toda la fuerza y empuje.
El solicita un préstamo para capitalizar su negocio y surtirlo con granos, abarrotes, legumbres, refrescos, entre otros. De esta forma podrá volver a levantar su negocio de entre las cenizas del olvido e impulsarlo por el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en: This is the story of a veteran of life who has faced many problems but has been able to resolve and overcome each and every one of them, allowing him to acquire a wealth of experience and wisdom. His name is Jesús and he is a dedicated and hard-working man, who around seven years ago boldly decided to open a general store by the side of the road in the town of Chigorodó, with the aim of increasing his income. After opening the store, he had some family problems that forced him to close his business for a long time. Later he opened it again and now he is trying to make it work with all his energy and drive. He is requesting a loan to buy stock for his store such as grains, groceries, vegetables, sodas, etc. In this way he will be able to raise his business from the ashes and take it forward on the path to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy grains, groceries, vegetables, etc. for his convenience store.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LANFIALA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame BINTOU assise au millieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMA 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  39 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabougnouma 6 group are married women who on average are 40 years old with three children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Lanfiala, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Bintou, who is sitting in the middle of the picture of this Sabougnouma 6 group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one fourth of an hectare (about 0.6 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 39,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Benkola 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKOLA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FASSERIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Safoura, who is standing in the middle of the picture of this Benkola 1 group of women. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one half of an hectare (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and pay for tilling

loans.name: Benkola 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKOLA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FASSERIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame ANCHATA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKOLA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, de la semence, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  99 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkola 2 group are married women who on average are 30 years old with three children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Fasseribougou, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Anchata, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the picture of this Benkola 2 group of women.
