She will use her loan to buy seeds, two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two cans of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain three quarters of an hectare (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 99,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cassava and palm nuts to prepare cassava four and palm oil.

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack is 28 years old and married with one child who is four years old now. His wife supports the family with additional income that she gets from her clothes business. He has been selling spare parts for the last 10 years and the business is doing well. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has applied for a second loan of KES 27,000, which he will use to buy more spare parts to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

Isack serviced his previous loan successfully and he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy lubricant oil, car bolts, and wheels.

loans.name: Dancile

texts.en:
Dancile is 32 years old. She has requested a Kiva loan to support labour costs and buy fertilizer for the production of maize: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming Dancile wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labour costs needed in the production of maize

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be focused. 

Ann operates a farm where she grows tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. Ann describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of tea leaves to sell. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be different.

loans.use: buy more stocks of tea leaves

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has five children and describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of rice. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a rice-milling machine. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of rice.

loans.use: buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Esther has a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Esther dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 34 years old. He is married with four children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer needed during maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming Anastase wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying additional goods like rice and coal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of 2,000 helps Ayda to pay for her granddaughter's school fees.

loans.name: El Roble 2 Group

texts.es:
Santos es un agricultor de 57 años de edad del Departamento de Ahuachapan, el junto a dos vecinos de su comunidad forman el grupo solidario llamado "El Roble 2", los tres miembros del grupo se dedican al cultivo de granos basicos como lo son maiz, maicillo, frijol.
Santos tiene 25 años de casado, sus estudios los realizo hasta septimo grado de primaria,luego se dedico por completo a la agricultura junto a sus padres para apoyar la economia familiar,tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 10 y 22 años pero solo los dos menores estan actualmente en la escuela.
Santos tiene 40 años de experiencia en la agricultura,dicha actividad es la que le permite generar los recursos economicos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su grupo familiar.
Santos ha solicitado el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas a utilizar en el cultivo de los granos basicos y asi generar los ingresos que le permitan continuar  apoyando a sus hijos en el estudio, pues Santos sueña con ver a sus hijos realizarce como profesionales y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Santos is a 57-year-old farmer from the Ahuachapan region. He and two neighbors from his community make up the communal bank "El Roble 2." The three members of the group work in agriculture, growing basic grains such as corn, sorghum, and beans. Santos has been married for 25 years and attended elementary school up to seventh grade. After leaving school he went to work with his parents on the farm to be able to help support his family. He has three children between the ages of 10 and 22, but only the two youngest are currently in school. Santos has 40 years' experience in agriculture, and this work has allowed him to generate enough income to support his family. Santos is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies to use to grow basic grains, and thus to be able to continue supporting his children with their studies. Santos dreams of seeing his children become professionals and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in the village of Aknaghbyur in Tavush region. She lives with her husband, daughter (school-aged), son and daughter-in-law. Her husband works as a welder and her son works as a driver, but all family members are engaged in agriculture and poultry. Anahit has 50 chickens and she manages to sell from her farm a large amount of eggs and sometimes chickens.  As she says, the most beautiful and colorful part of her farm is her orchard full of currant and raspberry shrubs, and apple, pear, fig, plum and persimmon trees. She also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers and beans on her land. All these farm products she sells at the city wholesale market with the help of her husband. 

Now Anahit is requesting this loan to buy four piglets (to start swine breeding), and animal fodder and to organize agricultural activities in her orchard.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy maize flour and maize

loans.name: Lianna

texts.en:
Lianna lives with her large family in the village Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. She is 34 years old and she has a nice family: she lives with her husband, three children (school-aged), and retired parents-in-law. In order to earn their family living, Lianna and her husband are seriously engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Despite having such a big family, Lianna’s farm is not very big: a cow, 2 calves, 9 sheep, and 10 chickens. The milk, macun (Armenian national dairy-product), and eggs that she manages to sell bring very little income. These agricultural activities have come to be of great help for this family. On their plot of land Lianna and her husband cultivate potatoes and greens, which they sell at the city wholesale market. 

Lianna greatly needs this loan since she wants to buy potato seedlings and some medicine and fertilizer to develop their agricultural activities, which now bring the main income for her family.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and some medicine and fertilizer to develop their agricultural activities, which now bring the main income for her family

loans.name: Benkola 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKOLA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FASSERIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec madame BARAKISSA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKOLA 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la semence, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  86 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkola 3 group are married women who on average are 25 years old with two children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Fasseribougou, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is rice featuring Mrs. Barakissa, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the picture of this Benkola 3 group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two cans of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one half of an hectare (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 86,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 32 years old. She has spent five years in rice production. She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is a twenty-eight-year-old married male with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells drinks like soda, mineral water and beer to people around the border and Republic of Congo. He has been in the business since 2012, a business he started to look after his family and cater to their basic needs. He dreams of expanding his business to a depot and exporting to Congo. He wants a loan to buy soda, beer and boxes of mineral water to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and boxes of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino is a thirty-five-year old married male with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa sales, selling it to one of the leading agents in the area, ESCO Uganda. He hopes to expand his business, have a very big cocoa store, and fetch high profits to cater for the education and well-being of his family. Valentino is faced with the problem of bad weather and seasonal changes. He intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 37 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik lives with her family in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. She has a son and a daughter. Her husband is already retired and sometimes he does constructional work by order. Varsik’s son works as a security member at a private company. Varsik worked at a factory, then at the market as a saleswoman. Now she works at the bread combine as a backer. Together with her work and by the help of her family members, she runs farming and agriculture. On her farm, she has 4 pigs and 10 chickens (she sells meat and eggs). She cultivates some vegetables and fruits on their plot of land, which they use for their own needs.
 
Varsik wants to develop swine breeding and is asking for this loan to buy piglets and a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle. She hopes that this loan will bring success and enough income to provide for her family financially.

loans.use: to buy piglets and a lot of animal fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 27 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Suria 22 Mayo Group

texts.en:
Suria 22 Mayo is a group comprised of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Lemeon is the leader of the group. She is a 55-year-old widow with six children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Lemeon lives with her children in their own house in Taiz city.  Lemeon's husband passed away several years ago. He was the sole breadwinner of the family. Recently, the main source income for the family is from renting their house. Most of apartments in the house are rented. Lemeon says that her house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford them. Unfortunately, Lemeon doesn't have enough money to purchase all the home appliances. For this reason, Lemeon is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances for the house. 

Lemeon looks forward to improving the condition of her family. Her dream in the future is to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Zulma Yanira

texts.es:
Zulma de 25 años de edad, está estudiando laboratorio clínico, actualmente está realizando el año social en una unidad de salud, esta acompañada el esposo es empleado y solo llega a su casa los fines de semana, ya que por la lejanía de su trabajo él no puede viajar todos los días, así que madruga los días lunes y regresa los sábados por la tarde, en ese tiempo ella vive junto a sus padres ya que está embarazada y es su último mes de gestación no puede pasar sola en su casa y así los padres están pendientes del avance y el nacimiento del bebe que ya está  muy cerca.

Ella está realizando el año social de sus estudios en una unidad de salud ubicada a unos 45 minutos en autobús desde su casa.  Ella tiene que madrugar todos los días y llegar tarde a su casa ya que el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 4:00pm, a ella le sale muy pesado pero lo hace con mucho gusto a pesar de su embarazo, sabiendo que la recompensa será cuando ya tenga su título para ejercer este oficio.

Con el crédito ella podrá comprar electrodomésticos para su hogar,  ya que por ahorita por su embarazo vive con sus padres pero cuando el bebe nazca se independizara de ellos para formar una vida junto a su esposo y bebe, comprando todo de una sola vez los adquirirá a un precio más bajo y el costo de traslado será menor ya que realizara un solo viaje y un solo pago.

Ella desea culminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión, desea que su hijo crezca en las mejores condiciones, darle un hogar digno junto a su esposo lleno de mucho amor hacia él.
texts.en: Zulma is 25 years old and is studying Clinical Laboratory Science. She is currently on a year-long internship in a health center. She has a husband who she only sees at weekends because he works too far away to commute every day. He leaves their house very early on Monday mornings and comes back on Saturday afternoons. While her husband is away, Zulma lives with her parents, as she is pregnant and in the final month of her pregnancy and therefore can't stay home alone. In this way, her parents can keep an eye on her as her due date is coming up. Zulma is currently doing a year-long work placement in a health center which is a 45-minute bus ride from her house. Zulma wakes up early every day and arrives home late as her working day is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. She finds it tiring, but she enjoys it, despite being pregnant, because she knows that it will be worth it when she graduates. She is requesting the loan to buy household appliances because although she is currently living with her parents, when the baby is born she is going to live with her husband and their baby. She wants to buy all the appliances at once so that she can get a better price and will only have to pay for one delivery. Zulma wants to finish her studies and get a job in her profession. She hope that her child will be able to grow up in the best surroundings and that she and her husband will be able to give him or her a good home full of love

loans.use: to buy household appliances for her home.

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive con sus dos hijas ya mayores de edad, en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (bodega), tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer y hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Isabel is 56 years old and is a widow. She lives with her two adult daughters in the Zaña district, a village whose main industries are agriculture, trade and cattle-raising, located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She owns a grocery store, and has been running it for over five years. She has a loyal clientele and has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more groceries to stock her store and to help her business grow to generate more income for her family,

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Micro finance. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Benkola 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKOLA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FASSERIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec madame CHATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKOLA 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la semnce, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  86 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkola 4 group are married women. On average, they are 27 years old, have four children, and live in traditional families in Fasseribougou, a village in the town of Loulouni, Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their sixth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their past loans have been repaid.

They plant rice with Madame Chata, who is standing in the middle of the back row in this photo of Benkola 4. With this loan, she will buy seeds, two 50kg bags of fertilizer and two jugs of herbicide. She will also pay for plowing for 0.5 hectares. After the harvest, she sells her crops in the village in the markets of Sikasso. She sells for cash and credit to a clientele comprised of men and women.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 86,000 FCFA per season. Part of her loan will allow her to pay back the loan and interest. The rest will be used to help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil and rice.

loans.name: Betzaida Gloribel

texts.es:
Betzida es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad,  que con mucho sacrificio logro culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, al culminar sus estudios decidió acompañarse con un joven de sus misma edad, el cual trabaja en la agricultura.
 Actualmente ella no tiene hijos hicieron una pequeña casa donde vive con  su compañero de vida, ella aplico a un puesto de trabajo como tutora de un centro de desarrollo para niños (CDI)  en donde le dieron el empleo trabaja ahí desde inicios del 2013, ella labora todo el día, los cinco días de la semana  a ella le favorece ya que su empleo le queda cerca de donde ella vive. 
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar electrodomésticos  y compras para el hogar ya que están iniciando una vida independiente de sus padres y aún le faltan algunas cosas que son necesarias para el hogar.  Al comprar ella lo que necesita cree que su condición de vida será mejor  para ella y su esposo y sus futuros hijos.
Sueña a futuro construir una casa  que cuente con todo lo indispensable en un hogar,  para que el futuro que vengan sus hijos poder tener algo que ofrecerles.
texts.en: Betzida is a 21-year-old, young, enterprising woman who worked hard to finish high school. When she finished her studies, she got together with a young man of her age, who works in agriculture. They do not have any children yet, but they have made a small home where they live together. She applied for a job as a tutor in an educational center for children and has been working there since the beginning of 2013. She works all day, five days a week, and her job is close to where she lives. She wants to use the loan to buy domestic appliances and make other purchases for her home, as her and her partner are trying to start a life together, independent from their parents, and they are still lacking some things that they need. She believes that through making these purchases, their quality of life will improve, as will that of their future children. She dreams of building a home with everything that she needs, so that when their children arrives she will have something to offer them.

loans.use: to buy domestic appliances for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy arable land.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old businessman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. He also earns a salary as a civil servant at the district and operates a retail shop in order to raise money to meet his family's daily expenses.  He maintains his desires to educate his children up to the University and build rental houses to secure their future despite inadequate capital, unpredictable weather changes and people who buy on credit and do not pay him. His business goal is to trade in wholesale and expand his business to new markets. John will use the loan to buy soap, tealeaves, salt and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soap, tealeaves, salt and soft drinks

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking man who is 38 years old and married to one wife who supports him with additional income.  He has been blessed with one child who is five months old.  He has been running his butchery business for the last four years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.  

James was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and he is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He plans to use the loan to buy more goats for slaughtering to add to his stock of meat to sell to his clients.  He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent house for his family.

He hopes to expand his business, become a famous businessman and own many assets in the near future.

loans.use: To buy goats to slaughter

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
Silvia, se encuentra sin capital suficiente para adquirir la mercadería que le permita cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y se decidió por solicitar un nuevo financiamiento con el que comprara ropa nueva, cereales, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas etc.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para comparar productos que fortalecieran la tienda, las ventas y ganancias mejoraron, pero como es un negocio de subsistencia no le permite ahorrar lo suficiente para que sea autosostenible es por ello que hace muy buen uso de los créditos.
texts.en: Silvia cannot afford to buy the merchandise that she needs to meet the needs of her customers, so she has decided to request another loan to buy products that will strengthen her store, her sales, and her profits. As it is a subsistence business, she is not able to save enough to make it self-sufficient, and for this reason she makes sure that she invests the loans well.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, cereal, juice, soda, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, clothespins, grease powder and children's clothes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 32 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more eggs to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of eggs within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a vehicle to transport eggs. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her egg business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy cassava root and red oil.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 34-year-old married man with 2 children. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children to university level. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance. He will use the anticipated profits to open a motorcycle spare parts shop.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina tiene 47años de edad, de estado civil soltera, en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y cerveza, desde hace 14 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de fideo, leches, azúcar y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clementina is a 47-year old single woman who lives in the Oyotún district, a community that is mainly involved in agriculture, trade and stockbreeding. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque, north coast of Perú. 

She sells basic necessities and beer. Her business, which she started 14 years ago, is located at her house. She has requested a loan of 1,500 new soles to Adpyme Alternativa to buy noodles, milk and sugar. Her goal is to expand the business and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Absalon

texts.es:
Absalon tiene 48 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y 6 menores hijos de 14,12, 10, 8 , 6 y 2 años de edad, los cuatro primeros estudian en colegio primario y el quinto en institución inicial de caserío Frayle, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Absalón es la cría y comercialización de animales menores (cuyes y gallinas), tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro, compra en el Caserío Frayle y Viza, para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo en los restaurants del Distrito de Santo Tomás. Tiene cultivado maíz amarillo que lo utiliza en el engorde de sus animales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para engordar y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Absalón is a 48-year old man who lives with his wife and 6 minor children, ages 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 2. The four oldest ones attend primary school and the fifth one goes to an institution in Frayle, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás. People in this district work in agriculture, trade and stockbreeding and it is located in the province of Cutervo, in Region Cajamarca, north mountains of Perú. 

Absalón breeds and sells small animals (hens and guinea pigs) and has a broad experience in the field. He buys in the small villages of Frayle and Viza and then sells in restaurants of Santo Tomás. He also cultivates yellow corn, which he uses to fatten the animals. 

He is requesting a loan of 500 new soles to Edpyme Alternativa that he will use it to buy small animals to breed and sell at a higher price to his customers.

loans.use: to buy small animals that he will then fatten.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 33 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have five children. She will use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizer for rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With her profits from farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs for rice production

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is a married woman with four schoolgoing children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuations as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking  oil

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is a 67-year-old widowed woman. She lives in the small village of Samtredia district with her son and his family. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees and corn are grown. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. They sell approximately 100-150 kg of nuts every year. Liana decided to start an animal husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1650 GEL to purchase a cow. Liana will produce dairy products to sell locally. This will enable her to increase the family income and thus improve living conditions. Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jhan Carlos

texts.es:
Jhan es un joven de 19 años y a pesar de su edad ya tiene una esposa y una hija por las cuales debe responder con todo el cariño y empeño.
El adquirió conocimientos en el área de la ebanistería gracias a su papa quien le enseño del oficio y le heredo su negocio ya que no puede atenderlo por su delicado estado de salud.
En el negocio fabrican toda clase de artículos en madera y realizan arreglos y reformas de closets, camas, entre otros.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y capitalizar su negocio dándole un impulso económico y productivo que le permita mantenerlo vigente y realizando buena competencia.
Su mayor motivación siempre ha sido su pequeña hija de 1 año y aunque su llegada lo tomo por sorpresa el ha decidido sacarla adelante con amor y coraje dándole la oportunidad de crecer en un entorno de armonía.
texts.en:
Jhan is 19 years old. In spite of his young age, he already has a wife and daughter, for whom he seeks to take responsibility with all the affection and determination he has. He learned cabinetmaking thanks to his father, who taught him this trade and passed his business on to him when he could no longer attend to it due to his delicate state of health. In the business they make all types of wooden items, as well as repairing and refurbishing wardrobes, beds, and other furniture.

Jhan is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials and capitalise his business, giving it a boost to its finances and productivity, which will allow him to keep the business current and competitive. 

His greatest motivation has always been his little daughter, who is one year old. Even though her arrival took him by surprise he has decided to do his best for her with love and courage, giving her an opportunity to grown up in a harmonious environment.

loans.use: to buy wood, his raw material.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 33 years old. She lives in the Rustavi district and she works at the local school's cafeteria as a baker. She is a very hardworking young woman. 

Shorena has decided to start her own business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $500 to start a trading business. She will get orders for home products, go to Turkey to purchase them, and then resell in Rustavi. This will increase her income and she will reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to start a trading business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked local food. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food such as raw bananas, sweet potatoes and tomatoes, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and improve on her family living standard. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a business vehicle . 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food such as raw bananas, sweet potatoes and tomatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Issa Pathe

texts.fr:
issa est un homme de 55 ans qui s’active dans la vente de bétails et d’aliments pour  bétails depuis plus de 15 ans. Il fait aussi de l’élevage de vaches. Pendant 15 ans, issa n’a pratiquement pas eu besoin de recourir à une quelconque mutuelle pour y emprunter de l’argent. Mais vu présentement  qu’il a envie de plus développer son activité, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000F CFA  pour acheter une grande quantité de moutons et chèvres.
Il a comme charges : de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de son foyer (car il est marié et père de 8 enfants) ; mais aussi de s’occuper de ses bêtes pour pouvoir les revendre. Il veut davantage augmenter son cheptel.
texts.en: Issa is a 55-year old man who has been selling livestock and food for livestock for the past 15 years. He also raises cows. For the past 15 years he has had practically no need to have recourse to any mutual institution in order to borrow money. However, because he now wants to develop his business further, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 FCFA so that he can buy a large quantity of sheep and goats. His expenses include providing for his household's daily needs (since he is married with eight children) but also taking care of his animals so that he can resell them. He would like to increase his herd of animals further.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats, fatten them up and then resell them.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
María Celina tiene 23 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y 3 menores hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, las últimas son hijas gemelas, el primero estudia en institución inicial del Caserío El Frayle una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura cultivo de maíz amarillo criollo duro, adicionalmente cría animales menores gallinas, patos, cuyes y cerdos; ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de tres cerdos pequeños para engorde de los mimos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Celina is a 23-year old woman who lives with his husband and 3 minor children, ages 3 and 2. The youngest ones are twin girls and the oldest one attend an institution in the small village of Frayle, a rural zone in the district of Santo Tomás. People in this district work in agriculture, trade and stockbreeding and it is located in the province of Cutervo, in Region Cajamarca, north mountains of Perú. 

She works in agriculture and cultivates yellow, creole and hard corn. Additionally, she breeds small animals, such as hens, ducks, guinea pigs and pigs. She has requested a loan of 800 new soles to Edpyme Alternativa to buy 3 small pigs to fatten and sell. Her goal is to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Bole Khole Group

texts.fr: BOLE KHOLE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 personnes habitant toutes dans le même quartier  et organisent ensemble des tontines tous les fins de mois. Elles sont à leur 1er prêt et ont comme présidente Madame Adama. On le reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 33 ans, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et évolue dans l’agriculture et le maraîchage. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter des semences, et intrants pour cultiver le gombo, l’oignon  etc.……  A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir plus de terres à cultiver pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses cultures. Ainsi elle pourra vivre dans le confort et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bole Khole is a women's group comprised of 10 people who live in the same neighborhood. Together, they have a savings group that they organize at the end of each month. This is their first loan, and the group's president is Madame Adama who has her hand raised in the photo. 

She is married and a mother. She is 33 years old, and helps her husband with the daily expenses as well as her children's schooling fees. She has more than five years' experience in farming and market gardening. She is asking for a loan for this amount to buy seeds and farm inputs to grow okra, onion, etc. 

In the future, she would like to have more land to farm, so that she can increase her revenue and diversify her crops. She would like to live in comfort and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs for farming.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two schoolgoing children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat, flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa appreciates her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.She is requesting for a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale .

loans.name: Wilfredo Geovani

texts.es:
Wilfredo, vive junto a su esposa, cinco hijos de 20, 18, 16, 12 y 7 años de edad, viven en casa alquilada, su negocio consiste en venta y reparación de llantas, oficio que aprendió como ayudante hace ya 12 años, actualmente tiene 10 años de hacerlo de manera independiente, lo realiza con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos, no representa dificultades en administrar su negocio.
Comprará tubos, llantas, parches, pegamento, etc., equipara su taller con lo necesario para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y agilizar su trabajo, espera mejorar su situación económica para cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos.
Su visión es abrir otro punto de servicio para tener más ingresos que utilizará para comprar una propiedad en la que construirá su casa propia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives with his wife and 5 children, ages 20, 18, 16, 12 and 7, in a rented house. His business is involved in the sale and repair of wheel rims, something that he learned as an assistant 12 years ago. He has been in the business for 10 years working independently. Two of his children help him and no financial difficulties exist at the moment. 

He will buy tubes, wheel rims, patches, glue, etc. so that his repair shop will be well equipped to provide a good and faster service to customers. He expects to improve his financial situation so that he can meet his different obligations. 

His goal is to open another service location and to obtain more income to buy some land for his own house.

loans.use: to buy tubes, wheel rims, patches, glue, etc.

loans.name: Bokk Yakar Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BOkK YAKAR est composé de 10 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même village et fond parties d’un regroupement de femmes. Leur présidente s’appelle Thiané, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits divers comme le riz, oignons, crustacé et l’arachide. Elle sollicite ce prêt de ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandise et satisfaire les commandes de ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses journalières et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Agée de 33, c’est une femme qui a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle quitte sa maison à 8h pour y revenir l’après midi. Elle veut à l’avenir diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra pérenniser son activité et ouvrir d’autres points de vente.
texts.en:
The Bokk Yakar group is comprised of 10 women. They all live in the same village and belong to a women's group. Their president is named Thiané, and she has her hand raised in the photo. 

She is married and is a mother. She sells products like rice, onions, shellfish, and peanuts. She is asking for a loan for this amount to build up her inventory of items and to fulfill her clients' orders. 

She helps her husband with the management of the daily expenses and their children’s schooling fees. She is 33 years old, and has five years experience in her business. She leaves her home at 8 am and returns in the afternoon. 

In the future, she would like to diversify her products and increase her revenues in order to strengthen her business and open other points of sale.

loans.use: buy various products such as rice and onions for resale.

loans.name: Book Diom Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AND BOOK DIOM est composé de 10 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles vivent dans le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois que le besoin se présente.  Elles pratiquent les mêmes activités. KALTOME est la présidente du groupe et c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le sucre, le riz, l’huile et le savon.  Elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de famille, elle a une expérience de plus de 15ans dans cette activité. KALTOME demande ce crédit de ce  montant pour renforcer ses denrées et les diversifier. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières car elle a de grands enfants qui travaillent et prient les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle démarre sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 14h.  Elle souhaite diversifier son marchandise  et augmenter d’avantage ses produits alimentaires et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The And Book Diom group is made up of 10 women. They live in the same village and get together as often as necessary. The women are in the same small business.

Kaltome is the president of the group and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She has grown a business of selling various food items, such as sugar, rice, oil, and soap. Kaltome is 46 years old, married and the mother of a family. She has more than 15 years of experience in this business.

Kaltome is requesting this loan to expand her business and to offer a greater variety of products. She does not have any dependents because her children are grown and working and take care of the family's daily expenses. Kaltome begins her day at 10am and works until 2pm. She hopes to diversify her merchandise and to increase her supply of food products, as well as to improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase and resell various food items like sugar, milk, and rice

loans.name: Book Xalat Group

texts.fr: BOOK XALAT est un groupement de femmes qui vivent dans le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois que le besoin se présente. Etant conscientes de leur situation et celles de leurs familles, ces femmes ont prie leurs destins en main et cherchent tous les moyens nécessaires pour améliorer leurs conditions de vie. La présidente s’appelle KHARY, elle  est mariée et mère de famille, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans le commerce de riz, sucre et légumes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Âgée de 41 ans, elle est toujours brave et démarre sa journée  à 9h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. Et souhaite à l’avenir augmenter son stock de marchandises et gagner d’autres parts de marché.
texts.en:
Book Xalat is a group of women who live in the same village and who get together as often as necessary. Being conscious of their situation and those of their families, the women decided to take their destiny in their own hands and are searching together for the means to improve their living conditions.

The president of the group is named Khary; she is married and the mother of a family. She is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Khary is in the business of selling rice, sugar, and vegetables. She helps her husband with the daily expenses and with the schooling costs for their children. 

Khary is 41 years old. She is still brave and begins her day at 9am and works until 4pm. She has more than 20 years of experience in her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her stock of merchandise and to expand to other parts of the market.

loans.use: to purchase and resell food products

loans.name: Solidarite Fatoumata Group

texts.fr: SOLIDARITE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 09 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. FATOUMATA est leur présidente,  c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui est âgée de 49 ans. Elle évolue dans l’achat et la vente de riz qui est cultivé dans la vallée non loin du village. Malgré son âge, elle est très brave et a une expérience de plus de 5	ans dans cette activité. Elle gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille qui est composée de 2 enfants et de ses sœurs. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son marchandise. Fatoumata démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 14h. Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et acheter plus de riz pour le garder ultérieurement et le vendre après.
texts.en:
Solidarité Fatoumata Group is made up of nine women. They all live in the same village and join together whenever there is need. Fatoumata, with her hand raised in the photo, is their president. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She is advancing [her business] in the purchase and sale of rice that is grown in the valley near her village.

Despite her age, Fatoumata is very brave and has more than five years of experience in this business. She manages the daily expenses of her family, which consists of two children and her sisters. Fatoumata is seeking this loan to strengthen her business.

Fatoumata's day begins at 8:00am and ends at 2:00pm. She would also like to increase her income and purchase more rice to save and sell later.

loans.use: To purchase rice that is grown in the valley to sell.

loans.name: Solidarite Book Ligueye Group

texts.fr: SOLIDARITE BOOK LIGUEYE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier  et font pratiquement les mêmes activités.  La personne qui a levé la main sur la photo s’appelle KHADY. Elle est la présidente de ce regroupement qui organise chaque mois des tontines. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et chaussures  et a une expérience de plus de 8ans et elle est agée de 03 ans. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle gère aussi ses besoins personnels. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 13h car elle doit préparer le repas de midi de ses enfants qui ne sont pas encore majeurs. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus dans le marché. Khady souhaite aussi à l’avenir devenir autonome pour financer d’avantage ses sœurs  sans l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en:
Solidarite Book Ligueye is a group of ten women. They all live in the same neighborhood and do similar work. The person with her hand raised in the photo is named Khady. She is the president of this savings group. 

Khady has been working selling fabric and shoes for more than eight years. She is seeking this loan so that she can buy and resell fabric in the market.

She starts her day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 1 p.m., because she must look after her children who are not grown yet.

Khady helps her husband with the daily expenses and their children's school fees. She also manages her personal needs. 

She wishes in the future to become independent and financially help her sisters more without the help of the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr: FASS DIOM est un groupement de promotion féminine qui est composé de 06 personnes. Elles habitent toutes ensemble fond pratiquement les mêmes activités. Celle qui a levé la main sur la photo s’appelle Bineta, elle est la présidente de ce groupement. Son activité principale consiste à acheter et vendre du poisson frais, des crustacés et des légumes pour les revendre ensuite dans le marché locale de sa commune. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, âgée de 37ans elle gère toujours les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a plus de 06 ans d’expérience et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandise et satisfaire ces clients.  Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus en diversifiant ses marchandises et cela elle ne le pourra faire qu’avec l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en:
Fass Diom is a group promoting women. It is made up of six people who all live together and run very similar businesses. The woman raising her hand in the photograph is Bineta, the group's president.

Her main business consists in buying fresh fish, shellfish, and vegetables, and to resell those products at the local market in her village.

She's 37 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She always cover the daily expenses of her family, as well as her children's school expenses.

She has more than six years of experience and starts her day at 8 in the morning, to finish it at 7 in the evening. She's seeking this loan to bolster her stock of products and satisfy her customers.

She would also like to increase her income by diversifying her product offering, which she will only be able to do with support from the MFI.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, and vegetables

loans.name: Book Ligueye Mbodiene Group

texts.fr: BOOK LIGUEYE  est un groupement composé de 10 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et font des tontines et se rassemblent tous les fins de mois. Elles veulent tenir leur destin en main cause pour la quelle elles sont venues dans l’institution pour prendre du crédit et renforcer leurs activité. Elles ont comme présidente Madame Marie qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales  comme le mil, le maïs, le niébé, le bissap. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Marie demande ce prêt de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des céréales  dans le marché de sa commune. Elle veut augmenter ses revenus à l’avenir pour avoir le confort et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
BOOK LIGUEYE is a group composed of ten persons who are all women. They live in the same district, form tontines, and gather at the end of each month. They want to take their future into their own hands, so they are here in this microfinance institution to take out a loan and bolster their businesses. Their president is Ms. Marie, whose hand is raised in the photo. She is a married mother of a family and works at selling grains, such as millet and corn, and black-eye peas and dried hibiscus flowers. She has over five years of experience. Her day starts at 8 AM and finishes at 7 PM. 

Marie is asking for this loan at this time to purchase grains to sell at the market in her commune. She wants to increase her revenues in the future, so as to be comfortable and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grains, such as millet and corn, to resell

loans.name: Sope Rokhaya Group

texts.fr: SOPE ROKHAYA est un groupement de femmes composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même village non loin du Guichet. Elles pratiquent les mêmes activités  dans un marché. Marième est leur présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 49 ans, elle est active et évolue dans l’embouche. On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle demande ce crédit pour  acheter des moutons et chèvres pour les élever et les revendre. Marième a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans ce métier. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Pour les charges, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle voudrait augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
SOPE ROKHAYA is a group of women composed of ten persons living in the same village not far from the branch office. The women have the same businesses at a market. Marième is their president. She is a married mother of a family. She is 49 years old and active, working at fattening livestock. She can be spotted in the photo with her hand raised. 

Marième is asking for this loan to purchase some sheep and goats to raise and then resell. She has over ten years of experience in this trade. Her days starts at 8 AM and finishes at 7 PM. As for expenses, she helps out her husband in managing the day-to-day expenses of the family. She would like to increase her revenues and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to resell

loans.name: Mame Abou Aziz Group

texts.fr: MAME ABDOU AZIZ est un groupement de promotion féminine qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes ensemble fond pratiquement les mêmes activités. Celle qui a levé la main sur la photo s’appelle Maguette, elle est la présidente de ce groupement. Son activité principale consiste à acheter et vendre du riz très prisé dans cette localité. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, âgée de 60ans elle gère toujours les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a plus de 10 ans d’expérience et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandise et satisfaire ces clients.  Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus en diversifiant ses marchandises et cela elle ne le pourra faire qu’avec l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en: MAME ABDOU AZIZ is a women's group comprising ten members.  All members of the group live close to one another and they are involved in very similar activities.  Maguette, the group's president, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is mostly involved in buying and selling rice, a commodity which is in very high demand in her locality.  Maguette is married and the mother of a family.  At age 60 she still manages her family's daily expenses and covers the children's school fees.  She has more than 10 years of experience in her field and works from 8 AM until 7 PM.  She is taking this loan to boost her stock of goods and to meet the needs of her customers.  She would also like to diversify her merchandise and therefore increase her income, something that she will not be able to do without the help of the micro-finance institution.

loans.use: to buy food products such a rice, for resale.

loans.name: Deggo Joubale Group

texts.fr: DEGGO JOUBALE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 5 personnes qui sont toutes du même quartier et font pratiquement les mêmes métiers. Etant à leur 2ème prêt, elles ont choisi comme présidente Madame Sophie qui est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et évolue dans la vente de tissus. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour aller à la Mauritanie et acheter des tissus légers qui sont très prisées dans cette localité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir ; elle souhaite aller plus loin en augmentant ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Deggo Joubale Group is made up of five women who all live in the same neighbourhood and work in very similar businesses.  As this will be the group's second loan, they have chosen Sophie to be their president.  She is a married woman with children.  She has been selling fabric for more than five years, and she helps her husband to pay for the daily expenses of their family.

Sophie has requested this loan to enable her to travel to Mauritania in order to purchase light fabrics which are highly desired in her area.  She starts working at eight in the morning and finishes at six in the evening.

In the future, Sophie would like to develop her business further by increasing her income.  She would also like to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Takky Ligueye Mbodiene Group

texts.fr: TAKKU LIGUEYE est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois que le besoin se présente. Elles ont par présidente la dame Fatou qui a levé la main sur la photo. C’est une femme très brave qui conduit ses consœurs  dans le développement de leur commune. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, Fatou gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales et sollicite ce montant pour acheter du mil, maïs, arachides et des haricots pour ensuite les vendre. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3 an et démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16h de l’après – midi. A l’avenir elle souhaite gagner d’avantages de parts dans la marché et devenir autonome grâce à l’institution.
texts.en:
TAKKU LIGUEYE is a women’s group of 10 members. They all live in the same village and get together whenever necessary. The group’s president is Fatou, whose hand is raised in the photo. A very brave woman, she is a leader for her colleagues in the development of their community. 

Fatou is married with two children. She is responsible for her family’s day-to-day expenses and her children’s tuition fees. To that end, she runs a commercial activity selling cereals. She works from 9 A.M. to 4 P.M., and she has over 3 years of experience doing this. 

Fatou is seeking this loan to stock up on millet, maize, groundnuts and beans to sell. Her goals for the future are to hold a larger share of the market and to someday become self-sufficient with the help of the MFI.

loans.use: to stock up on millet, maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Amoul Seral Group

texts.fr: AMOUL SERAL est un groupement de promotion féminin. Il est composé de 05 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et font pratiquement le même métier. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin pour organiser des tontines. Madame Fatoumata est leur présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales comme le mil, maïs, le pain de singe et les haricots (niébés). Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels. Elle demande ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle voudrait renforcer d’avantage son activité et diversifier son marchandise. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Amoul Seral is a group of five women who all live in the same neighbourhood and work in the same area, selling cereals.  Together, they run a savings group.

Fatoumata is the president of the group, she is married and has children.  She has been selling cereals such as millet and maize, and also baobab fruit and beans for more than three years.  Fatoumata is responsible only for her own expenses.  She has requested this loan in order to increase her stockholding levels and respond to the demands of her customers.  She works from nine in the morning until four in the afternoon.

Fatoumata would like to strengthen her business and diversify the range of products she offers.  She hopes this will increase her revenue and allow her to save more.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as rice, millet and maize, for resale.

loans.name: Rainabe I Group

texts.fr: RAINABE 1 est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois que le besoin se présente. Oureye est leur présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le sucre, le lait, les savons, l’huile, le riz. C’est elle qui est au gros plan devant sur la photo. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16 et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter et vendre les denrées alimentaires. A l’avenir, elle voudrait devenir autonome et gagner le monopole du marché. Ainsi elle pourra gagner plus d’argent et épargner.
texts.en: RAINABE 1 is a women's group comprising ten members.  All members of the group live in the same neighborhood and they get together whenever they need to.  Oureye is the group's president.  She is married and the mother of a family.  She sells staple goods such as sugar, milk, soap, oil and rice.  In the photo, she is the woman in the foreground.  She works from 9AM until 4PM and she helps her husband to cover the daily expenses and the children's school fees.  She needs this loan to buy and sell basic food products.  In the future, she would like to become independent and have a monopoly on the market.  Her goal is to increase her income and save some money.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as sugar, milk, coffee, soap and oil, for resale.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad. María se ha preparado académicamente como cosmetóloga, desde hace 6 años tiene una sala de belleza, trabaja en un horario de nueve de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Invertirá en mejorar el inventario de su negocio comprando tintes, esmaltes, cremas corporales, tratamientos para el cabello, maquillaje y otros productos necesarios para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar teniendo ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia y cancelar con un buen record crediticio su deuda.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio mejor equipado y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is a married woman who lives with her two children, ages 22 and 18. María has studied to become a cosmetologist and has had a beauty salon for 6 years. She works from 9am to 5pm. 

She will use the loan to buy stock for the business, including dye, nail polish, body creams, hair treatments, make-up and other products she needs to provide a good service to her clients. Her goal is to keep obtaining income to cover her family's expenses and to repay her debts with a good credit rating. She would like to have a better equipped business and to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy dye, nail polish, body creams, hair treatments, make-up and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools such as a polisher, a lathe and an electric saw.

loans.name: Lonlongnon-Djita Afagnagan Group

texts.fr: Amégninou, 46 ans,  a 3 enfants. Il fait partie d'un groupe de 10 personnes  nommé Lonlongnon-Djita /Afagnagan. C'est un homme  plein d'idées et au fort esprit entrepreneurial. Président du groupe,  Amégninou fait du stockage de maïs et du haricot  et des petits commerces, il utilise son argent pour créer des  sources de revenus. Les autres membres du groupe font  aussi du commerce de fagots de bois, de beignets, de manioc, de piments, de cartes de recharges, …… cette deuxième  demande de microcrédit servira à s’approvisionner. Ils sont heureux de pouvoir bénéficier de l'aide des prêteurs de Kiva  et remercient  ceux qui croiront en leurs  projets.
texts.en:
Amégninou, 46, has three children. He is part of a group of 10 people named Lonlongnon-Djita / Afagnagan. He is full of ideas and has a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

President of the group, Amégninou stores maize and beans and runs small businesses; he uses his money to create revenue. The other group members are also retail merchants of wood bundles, doughnuts, cassava, peppers, card refills, ...

This second micro-credit request will be used to resupply. They are pleased they can benefit from the help provided by Kiva lenders and thank those who believe in their projects.

loans.use: buy maize for storage and various items

loans.name: Jekabara 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKABARA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZANGABOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame AWA assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JEKABARA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, de la semence, 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  63 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jekabara 1 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with five children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Zangabougou, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Awa, who is sitting in the middle in the picture of this Jekabara 1 group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one half of an hectare (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 63,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Benkola 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKOLA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et ont en moyenne 1 enfant et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FASSERIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec madame ABI assise au millieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKOLA 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la semence, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkola 5 group are married women who on average are 22 years old with one child. For the most part they live in traditional families in Fasseribougou, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is rice featuring Mrs. Abi, who is sitting in the middle in the picture of this Benkola 5 group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one half of an hectare (about 1.24 acres).
