After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven luchadora, soltera y vive en el Distrito de Quilmana en la casa de su tía.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja como ayudante de cocina y atención al público en el negocio de su tía.
Con los ingresos obtenidos Gabriela  apoya con los gastos del hogar y ahorra otra parte de sus ganancias.
Ella es una joven que quiere salir adelante, por eso se esfuerza al máximo cada día para lograr sus objetivos.
Gabriela está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá hacer arreglos en su hogar y así mejorar su calidad de vida. De esta manera seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para cumplir más adelante su gran sueño: “Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hard-working single young woman who lives in the Quilmana district in her aunt's house. She has been working for a year as a kitchen assistant and serving the customers in her aunt's business. With the income she earns Gabriela helps towards the household expenses and also saves part of her earnings. She is a young woman who wants to make progress in life and so she works as much as possible every day to achieve her objectives. 

Gabriela is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help provided she will be able to carry out some improvements in her home and so improve her quality of life. And so she will be able to continue working very hard to to fulfil her dream of having her own business in the future.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es: Carlos de 64 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 64 years old, has worked in agriculture for several years and this has given him the necessary skills and knowledge to look after his crops. He mainly grows corn and beans and he sells his produce at agencies buying and selling basic grains which are near to his home. With the profits he makes from his sales he helps with his family's costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and children.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies which will help him to sow his crops, such as manure, seeds and fertilizers, and to improve the land which is shown in the photograph. This will enable him to have better profits and keep helping with his household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers and improve the land.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le dé la facilidad económica de adquirir lo necesario para cultivar maíz y frijol, comprara semilla, insecticidas, abono, herbicida y fertilizantes, con los que preparara el terreno y protegerá el cultivo de plagas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener una cosecha libre de plagas y muy abundante, mejoro las ganancias, cubrió las necesidades de su familia y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
José is in need of requesting a new loan that will give him the economic capacity of acquiring what he needs to cultivate corn and beans. He will buy seed, insecticide, manure, herbicide and fertilizer, with which he will prepare the land and protect the crops from pests.
The previous credit helped him to have a very abundant harvest free of pests. He improved his profits, covered the needs of his family, and repaid his debt.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, manure, herbicide and fertilizer.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old. He is married with two children and they all go to school. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer for rice production. The fertilizer is necessary in order to increase production. With the profits from farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Clare has been working hard to manage her farm business, where she has poultry and pigs. 

To help expand her business, Clare has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more piglets and chicken birds for the farm, and will help Clare to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Clare hopes that in the future she will be able to improve more on her piggery and chicken business to become a leading farmer in town. 

Clare is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chicken birds for the farm.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Sharifah has been working hard to manage her small food business, where she sells raw food . 

To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more types of raw food such as raw bananas, sweet potatoes and others to sell, and will help Sharifah to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Sharifah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Sharifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more types of raw food such as raw bananas and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business, where she makes craft items such as hand bags, necklaces etc. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making the crafts to sell, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make her craft products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair relaxers for the salon so as to attract more clients, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair relaxers for the salon.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to by more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and increase on her savings. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work equipment for making cakes.

loans.name: Theodole

texts.en:
Theodole is 52 years old. He is married with two children, and they are all still young and do not go to school yet. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer to increase rice production. With profits from farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
Rosalino tiene 25 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su conyuge, no tienes hijos a su cargo, vive en una comunidad pequeña con los cuales mantiene buenas relaciones, en el caserío El Pubelo Lo Hizo, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, cierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Rosalino es la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, posee seis reses de su propiedad, también cultiva café de la variedad catimor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero y de esta manera ofrecer a la venta leche fresca y quesos preparados de manera artesanal.
texts.en:
Rosalino is 25 years old. He has a stable household at the side of his spouse. They don't have any children in their care. He lives in a small community in which he maintains good relations. In the homestead El Pueblo Lo Hizo, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás, it's population in agriculture, commerce, and livestock for a living. It is Located in the province of Cutervo which is in the region of Cajamarca, in the north of Perú.

Rosalino is in the raising and selling of cattle for a living. He has 6 cattle on his property. He also cultivates Catimor coffee. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4,000 nuevos soles to buy dairy cattle and thus offer the sale of fresh milk and cheese prepared by hand.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with two school-going children. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Agnes has operated fruits and vegetable stall business for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widowed woman with four children all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 57 years old. She lives in the small village of Samtredia district with her daughter and her family. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested vegetables locally as well as use them for the family. 

Leila decided to purchase a pig and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to purchase a pig. She will sell the piglets seasonally and will generate income. Leila plans to reinvest the income in the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo tiene 46 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge tiene siete hijos en su poder en su casa de material rustico, se lleva bien con los miembros de su comunidad, vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada netamente a la actividad agropecuaria, en el Caserío La Granadilla, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas que pertenece a la Región Cutervo ubicada en la Provincia de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, lo cría en su inverna ubicada cerca a donde reside, también cultiva café de la variedad catimore su esposa le apoya en el ordeño del ganado lechero, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Timoteo is 46 years old. He has a stable household with his spouse. He has seven children in his care in his house made of rustic materials. He gets along well with the members of his community. He lives in a small community that is solely dedicated to agricultural activities. It is in Caserío La Granadilla, a rural zone of Santo Tomas district located in the Cutervo region which is in the Province of Cajamarca, land in the north of Perú.

He is in the raising and selling of cattle, breeding in his greenhouse located near his place of residence. He also cultivates catimore coffee. His wife helps him with the milking of the dairy cattle. He has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops and in this way have a timely production to offer his customers and generate better income for his family.

loans.use: .to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Julissa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Julissa Del Pilar tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, desde hace10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Julissa Del Pilar is 29 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives with her family in the Nueva Arica district situated in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The locals make a living from agriculture, commerce and livestock.

For 10 years Julissa Del Pilar has made a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, cockerels, hens, chickens and turkeys. Her business is located in her home.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles to buy a large quantity of animals which she will then fatten up and sell at a better price.

loans.use: to buy a large number of animals to sell on later at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas as manioc

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh food to sell, and will help Sylivia to generate greater profits and add more capital to increase her sales. Sylivia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Maria Idelisa

texts.es:
María una mujer afrodecendiente que por cuestiones de seguridad tuvo que dejar su tierra natal y aventurarse junto con su familia en un mundo nuevo para ella la ciudad.
Pero eso no es todo María es un verdadero ejemplo de superación pues a pesar de vivir el desplazamiento forzado es una mujer separa y tuvo que criar sus tres hijos ella sola, y lo hace gracias a la venta de ropa y productos por catálogo que alterna con la venta de comidas rápidas actividades que aprendió empíricamente ante  la necesidad de alimentar a sus hijos.
María agradece mucho a dios por esta oportunidad que le dio la vida pues está mejor de cómo estaba en su tierra natal aunque la extraña mucho y da mucha evidencia que lo único que frena el progreso del hombre es la pereza.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa y productos en promoción aspirando a mejorar su economía y cubriendo eventos de fechas especiales que se celebran en Colombia.
texts.en:
María is a woman of African descent who had to leave her homeland for security reasons and set out for a new world in the city with her family. But that's not everything; María is a real example of self-improvement, since despite going through the forced displacement she is separated and has had to bring up her three children on her own. She does this by selling clothing and products from catalogues, as well as selling fast food. She learnt these activities from scratch because of the need to provide food for her children.

María is very grateful to God for the opportunity she has been given in life since things are better better now than they were in her home country, although she misses it a lot. She sees a lot of evidence that the only thing stopping people from making progress is laziness.

She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of clothing and products on offer, hoping to improve her finances by covering events on special dates which are celebrated in Colombia.

loans.use: to buy clothing and catalogue products on offer which will give her more profit.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 38 years old. He is married with four children. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Barbra is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Barbra has been working hard to manage her brick business, where she sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making the bricks, and will help Barbra to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Barbra hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Barbra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm nuts and manioc to make palm oil and manioc flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy agricultural supplies that will help her to grow coffee.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su abuela de 91 años de edad quien depende de ella económicamente. María tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la prestación de servicios domésticos por que lo que recibe un pago lo cual le permite colaborar con la economía de su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su familia. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que actualmente no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y desea pagar por el derecho y la instalación de la misma y así poder contar con mejores condiciones.
texts.en: María is 41 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and her grandmother who is 91 years old and depends on her economically. María has been in domestic services for 12 years and her pay allows her to help with the household expenses and together with her husband maintain the economy of her family. María is applying for this loan from FUSAI since today she does not have electricity service and would like to pay for the right and installation of it so she can have better conditions.

loans.use: to install electricity service in her housing.
